SCHEDULE P: PRODUCTS AND RELATED DEFINITIONS “Ancillary Services” means any of the services identified by a Transmission Provider in its transmission tariff as “ancillary services” including, but not limited to, regulation and frequency response, energy imbalance, operating reserve-spinning and operating reserve-supplemental, as may be specified in the Transaction. “Capacity” has the meaning specified in the Transaction. “Energy” means three-phase, 60-cycle alternating current electric energy, expressed in megawatt hours. “Firm (LD)” means, with respect to a Transaction, that either Party shall be relieved of its obligations to sell and deliver or purchase and receive without liability only to the extent that, and for the period during which, such performance is prevented by Force Majeure. In the absence of Force Majeure, the Party to which performance is owed shall be entitled to receive from the Party which failed to deliver/receive an amount determined pursuant to Article Four. “Firm Transmission Contingent - Contract Path” means, with respect to a Transaction, that the performance of either Seller or Buyer (as specified in the Transaction) shall be excused, and no damages shall be payable including any amounts determined pursuant to Article Four, if the transmission for such Transaction is interrupted or curtailed and (i) such Party has provided for firm transmission with the transmission provider(s) for the Product in the case of the Seller from the generation source to the Delivery Point or in the case of the Buyer from the Delivery Point to the ultimate sink, and (ii) such interruption or curtailment is due to “force majeure” or “uncontrollable force” or a similar term as defined under the applicable transmission provider’s tariff. This contingency shall excuse performance for the duration of the interruption or curtailment notwithstanding the provisions of the definition of “Force Majeure” in Section 1.23 to the contrary. “Firm Transmission Contingent - Delivery Point” means, with respect to a Transaction, that the performance of either Seller or Buyer (as specified in the Transaction) shall be excused, and no damages shall be payable including any amounts determined pursuant to Article Four, if the transmission to the Delivery Point (in the case of Seller) or from the Delivery Point (in the case of Buyer) for such Transaction is interrupted or curtailed and (i) such Party has provided for firm transmission with the transmission provider(s) for the Product, in the case of the Seller, to be delivered to the Delivery Point or, in the case of Buyer, to be received at the Delivery Point and (ii) such interruption or curtailment is due to “force majeure” or “uncontrollable force” or a similar term as defined under the applicable transmission provider’s tariff. This transmission contingency excuses performance for the duration of the interruption or curtailment, notwithstanding the provisions of the definition of “Force Majeure” in Section 1.23 to the contrary. Interruptions or curtailments of transmission other than the transmission either immediately to or from the Delivery Point shall not excuse performance “Firm (No Force Majeure)” means, with respect to a Transaction, that if either Party fails to perform its obligation to sell and deliver or purchase and receive the Product, the Party to which performance is owed shall be entitled to receive from the Party which failed to perform an amount determined pursuant to Article Four. Force Majeure shall not excuse performance of a Firm (No Force Majeure) Transaction. “Into ______________ (the “Receiving Transmission Provider”), Seller’s Daily Choice” means that, in accordance with the provisions set forth below, (1) the Product shall be scheduled and delivered to an interconnection or interface (“Interface”) either (a) on the Receiving Transmission Provider’s transmission system border or (b) within the control area of the Receiving Transmission Provider if the Product is from a source of generation in that control area, which Interface, in either case, the Receiving Transmission Provider identifies as available for delivery of the Product in or into its control area; and (2) Seller has the right on a daily prescheduled basis to designate the Interface where the Product shall be delivered. An “Into” Product shall be subject to the following provisions: 1. Prescheduling and Notification. Subject to the provisions of Section 6, not later than the prescheduling deadline of 11:00 a.m. CPT on the Business Day before the next delivery day or as otherwise agreed to by Buyer and Seller, Seller shall notify Buyer (“Seller’s Notification”) of Seller’s immediate upstream counterparty and the Interface (the “Designated Interface”) where Seller shall deliver the Product for the next delivery day, and Buyer shall notify Seller of Buyer’s immediate downstream counterparty. 2. Availability of “Firm Transmission” to Buyer at Designated Interface; “Timely Request for Transmission,” “ADI” and “Available Transmission.” In determining availability to Buyer of next-day firm transmission (“Firm Transmission”) from the Designated Interface, a “Timely Request for Transmission” shall mean a properly completed request for Firm Transmission made by Buyer in accordance with the controlling tariff procedures, which request shall be submitted to the Receiving Transmission Provider no later than 30 minutes after delivery of Seller’s Notification, provided, however, if the Receiving Transmission Provider is not accepting requests for Firm Transmission at the time of Seller’s Notification, then such request by Buyer shall be made within 30 minutes of the time when the Receiving Transmission Provider first opens thereafter for purposes of accepting requests for Firm Transmission. Pursuant to the terms hereof, delivery of the Product may under certain circumstances be redesignated to occur at an Interface other than the Designated Interface (any such alternate designated interface, an “ADI”) either (a) on the Receiving Transmission Provider’s transmission system border or (b) within the control area of the Receiving Transmission Provider if the Product is from a source of generation in that control area, which ADI, in either case, the Receiving Transmission Provider identifies as available for delivery of the Product in or into its control area using either firm or non-firm transmission, as available on a day-ahead or hourly basis (individually or collectively referred to as “Available Transmission”) within the Receiving Transmission Provider’s transmission system. 3. Rights of Buyer and Seller Depending Upon Availability of/Timely Request for Firm Transmission. A. Timely Request for Firm Transmission made by Buyer, Accepted by the Receiving Transmission Provider and Purchased by Buyer. If a Timely Request for Firm Transmission is made by Buyer and is accepted by the Receiving Transmission Provider and Buyer purchases such Firm Transmission, then Seller shall deliver and Buyer shall receive the Product at the Designated Interface. i. If the Firm Transmission purchased by Buyer within the Receiving Transmission Provider’s transmission system from the Designated Interface ceases to be available to Buyer for any reason, or if Seller is unable to deliver the Product at the Designated Interface for any reason except Buyer’s non-performance, then at Seller’s choice from among the following, Seller shall: (a) to the extent Firm Transmission is available to Buyer from an ADI on a day-ahead basis, require Buyer to purchase such Firm Transmission from such ADI, and schedule and deliver the affected portion of the Product to such ADI on the basis of Buyer’s purchase of Firm Transmission, or (b) require Buyer to purchase non-firm transmission, and schedule and deliver the affected portion of the Product on the basis of Buyer’s purchase of non-firm transmission from the Designated Interface or an ADI designated by Seller, or (c) to the extent firm transmission is available on an hourly basis, require Buyer to purchase firm transmission, and schedule and deliver the affected portion of the Product on the basis of Buyer’s purchase of such hourly firm transmission from the Designated Interface or an ADI designated by Seller. ii. If the Available Transmission utilized by Buyer as required by Seller pursuant to Section 3A(i) ceases to be available to Buyer for any reason, then Seller shall again have those alternatives stated in Section 3A(i) in order to satisfy its obligations. iii. Seller’s obligation to schedule and deliver the Product at an ADI is subject to Buyer’s obligation referenced in Section 4B to cooperate reasonably therewith. If Buyer and Seller cannot complete the scheduling and/or delivery at an ADI, then Buyer shall be deemed to have satisfied its receipt obligations to Seller and Seller shall be deemed to have failed its delivery obligations to Buyer, and Seller shall be liable to Buyer for amounts determined pursuant to Article Four. iv. In each instance in which Buyer and Seller must make alternative scheduling arrangements for delivery at the Designated Interface or an ADI pursuant to Sections 3A(i) or (ii), and Firm Transmission had been purchased by both Seller and Buyer into and within the Receiving Transmission Provider’s transmission system as to the scheduled delivery which could not be completed as a result of the interruption or curtailment of such Firm Transmission, Buyer and Seller shall bear their respective transmission expenses and/or associated congestion charges incurred in connection with efforts to complete delivery by such alternative scheduling and delivery arrangements. In any instance except as set forth in the immediately preceding sentence, Buyer and Seller must make alternative scheduling arrangements for delivery at the Designated Interface or an ADI under Sections 3A(i) or (ii), Seller shall be responsible for any additional transmission purchases and/or associated congestion charges incurred by Buyer in connection with such alternative scheduling arrangements. B. Timely Request for Firm Transmission Made by Buyer but Rejected by the Receiving Transmission Provider. If Buyer’s Timely Request for Firm Transmission is rejected by the Receiving Transmission Provider because of unavailability of Firm Transmission from the Designated Interface, then Buyer shall notify Seller within 15 minutes after receipt of the Receiving Transmission Provider’s notice of rejection (“Buyer’s Rejection Notice”). If Buyer timely notifies Seller of such unavailability of Firm Transmission from the Designated Interface, then Seller shall be obligated either (1) to the extent Firm Transmission is available to Buyer from an ADI on a day-ahead basis, to require Buyer to purchase (at Buyer’s own expense) such Firm Transmission from such ADI and schedule and deliver the Product to such ADI on the basis of Buyer’s purchase of Firm Transmission, and thereafter the provisions in Section 3A shall apply, or (2) to require Buyer to purchase (at Buyer’s own expense) non-firm transmission, and schedule and deliver the Product on the basis of Buyer’s purchase of non-firm transmission from the Designated Interface or an ADI designated by the Seller, in which case Seller shall bear the risk of interruption or curtailment of the non-firm transmission; provided, however, that if the non-firm transmission is interrupted or curtailed or if Seller is unable to deliver the Product for any reason, Seller shall have the right to schedule and deliver the Product to another ADI in order to satisfy its delivery obligations, in which case Seller shall be responsible for any additional transmission purchases and/or associated congestion charges incurred by Buyer in connection with Seller’s inability to deliver the Product as originally prescheduled. If Buyer fails to timely notify Seller of the unavailability of Firm Transmission, then Buyer shall bear the risk of interruption or curtailment of transmission from the Designated Interface, and the provisions of Section 3D shall apply. C. Timely Request for Firm Transmission Made by Buyer, Accepted by the Receiving Transmission Provider and not Purchased by Buyer. If Buyer’s Timely Request for Firm Transmission is accepted by the Receiving Transmission Provider but Buyer elects to purchase non-firm transmission rather than Firm Transmission to take delivery of the Product, then Buyer shall bear the risk of interruption or curtailment of transmission from the Designated Interface. In such circumstances, if Seller’s delivery is interrupted as a result of transmission relied upon by Buyer from the Designated Interface, then Seller shall be deemed to have satisfied its delivery obligations to Buyer, Buyer shall be deemed to have failed to receive the Product and Buyer shall be liable to Seller for amounts determined pursuant to Article Four. D. No Timely Request for Firm Transmission Made by Buyer, or Buyer Fails to Timely Send Buyer’s Rejection Notice. If Buyer fails to make a Timely Request for Firm Transmission or Buyer fails to timely deliver Buyer’s Rejection Notice, then Buyer shall bear the risk of interruption or curtailment of transmission from the Designated Interface. In such circumstances, if Seller’s delivery is interrupted as a result of transmission relied upon by Buyer from the Designated Interface, then Seller shall be deemed to have satisfied its delivery obligations to Buyer, Buyer shall be deemed to have failed to receive the Product and Buyer shall be liable to Seller for amounts determined pursuant to Article Four. 4. Transmission. A. Seller’s Responsibilities. Seller shall be responsible for transmission required to deliver the Product to the Designated Interface or ADI, as the case may be. It is expressly agreed that Seller is not required to utilize Firm Transmission for its delivery obligations hereunder, and Seller shall bear the risk of utilizing non-firm transmission. If Seller’s scheduled delivery to Buyer is interrupted as a result of Buyer’s attempted transmission of the Product beyond the Receiving Transmission Provider’s system border, then Seller will be deemed to have satisfied its delivery obligations to Buyer, Buyer shall be deemed to have failed to receive the Product and Buyer shall be liable to Seller for damages pursuant to Article Four. B. Buyer’s Responsibilities. Buyer shall be responsible for transmission required to receive and transmit the Product at and from the Designated Interface or ADI, as the case may be, and except as specifically provided in Section 3A and 3B, shall be responsible for any costs associated with transmission therefrom. If Seller is attempting to complete the designation of an ADI as a result of Seller’s rights and obligations hereunder, Buyer shall co-operate reasonably with Seller in order to effect such alternate designation. 5. Force Majeure. An “Into” Product shall be subject to the “Force Majeure” provisions in Section 1.23. 6. Multiple Parties in Delivery Chain Involving a Designated Interface. Seller and Buyer recognize that there may be multiple parties involved in the delivery and receipt of the Product at the Designated Interface or ADI to the extent that (1) Seller may be purchasing the Product from a succession of other sellers (“Other Sellers”), the first of which Other Sellers shall be causing the Product to be generated from a source (“Source Seller”) and/or (2) Buyer may be selling the Product to a succession of other buyers (“Other Buyers”), the last of which Other Buyers shall be using the Product to serve its energy needs (“Sink Buyer”). Seller and Buyer further recognize that in certain Transactions neither Seller nor Buyer may originate the decision as to either (a) the original identification of the Designated Interface or ADI (which designation may be made by the Source Seller) or (b) the Timely Request for Firm Transmission or the purchase of other Available Transmission (which request may be made by the Sink Buyer). Accordingly, Seller and Buyer agree as follows: A. If Seller is not the Source Seller, then Seller shall notify Buyer of the Designated Interface promptly after Seller is notified thereof by the Other Seller with whom Seller has a contractual relationship, but in no event may such designation of the Designated Interface be later than the prescheduling deadline pertaining to the Transaction between Buyer and Seller pursuant to Section 1. B. If Buyer is not the Sink Buyer, then Buyer shall notify the Other Buyer with whom Buyer has a contractual relationship of the Designated Interface promptly after Seller notifies Buyer thereof, with the intent being that the party bearing actual responsibility to secure transmission shall have up to 30 minutes after receipt of the Designated Interface to submit its Timely Request for Firm Transmission. C. Seller and Buyer each agree that any other communications or actions required to be given or made in connection with this “Into Product” (including without limitation, information relating to an ADI) shall be made or taken promptly after receipt of the relevant information from the Other Sellers and Other Buyers, as the case may be. D. Seller and Buyer each agree that in certain Transactions time is of the essence and it may be desirable to provide necessary information to Other Sellers and Other Buyers in order to complete the scheduling and delivery of the Product. Accordingly, Seller and Buyer agree that each has the right, but not the obligation, to provide information at its own risk to Other Sellers and Other Buyers, as the case may be, in order to effect the prescheduling, scheduling and delivery of the Product “Native Load” means the demand imposed on an electric utility or an entity by the requirements of retail customers located within a franchised service territory that the electric utility or entity has statutory obligation to serve. “Non-Firm” means, with respect to a Transaction, that delivery or receipt of the Product may be interrupted for any reason or for no reason, without liability on the part of either Party. “System Firm” means that the Product will be supplied from the owned or controlled generation or pre-existing purchased power assets of the system specified in the Transaction (the “System”) with non-firm transmission to and from the Delivery Point, unless a different Transmission Contingency is specified in a Transaction. Seller’s failure to deliver shall be excused: (i) by an event or circumstance which prevents Seller from performing its obligations, which event or circumstance was not anticipated as of the date the Transaction was agreed to, which is not within the reasonable control of, or the result of the negligence of, the Seller; (ii) by Buyer’s failure to perform; (iii) to the extent necessary to preserve the integrity of, or prevent or limit any instability on, the System; (iv) to the extent the System or the control area or reliability council within which the System operates declares an emergency condition, as determined in the system’s, or the control area’s, or reliability council’s reasonable judgment; or (v) by the interruption or curtailment of transmission to the Delivery Point or by the occurrence of any Transmission Contingency specified in a Transaction as excusing Seller’s performance. Buyer’s failure to receive shall be excused (i) by Force Majeure; (ii) by Seller’s failure to perform, or (iii) by the interruption or curtailment of transmission from the Delivery Point or by the occurrence of any Transmission Contingency specified in a Transaction as excusing Buyer’s performance. In any of such events, neither party shall be liable to the other for any damages, including any amounts determined pursuant to Article Four. “Transmission Contingent” means, with respect to a Transaction, that the performance of either Seller or Buyer (as specified in the Transaction) shall be excused, and no damages shall be payable including any amounts determined pursuant to Article Four, if the transmission for such Transaction is unavailable or interrupted or curtailed for any reason, at any time, anywhere from the Seller’s proposed generating source to the Buyer’s proposed ultimate sink, regardless of whether transmission, if any, that such Party is attempting to secure and/or has purchased for the Product is firm or non-firm. If the transmission (whether firm or non-firm) that Seller or Buyer is attempting to secure is from source to sink is unavailable, this contingency excuses performance for the entire Transaction. If the transmission (whether firm or non-firm) that Seller or Buyer has secured from source to sink is interrupted or curtailed for any reason, this contingency excuses performance for the duration of the interruption or curtailment notwithstanding the provisions of the definition of “Force Majeure” in Article 1.23 to the contrary. “Unit Firm” means, with respect to a Transaction, that the Product subject to the Transaction is intended to be supplied from a generation asset or assets specified in the Transaction. Seller’s failure to deliver under a “Unit Firm” Transaction shall be excused: (i) if the specified generation asset(s) are unavailable as a result of a Forced Outage (as defined in the NERC Generating Unit Availability Data System (GADS) Forced Outage reporting guidelines) or (ii) by an event or circumstance that affects the specified generation asset(s) so as to prevent Seller from performing its obligations, which event or circumstance was not anticipated as of the date the Transaction was agreed to, and which is not within the reasonable control of, or the result of the negligence of, the Seller or (iii) by Buyer’s failure to perform. In any of such events, Seller shall not be liable to Buyer for any damages, including any amounts determined pursuant to Article Four.

(“Party A”) and Sam Rayburn Municipal Power Agency (“Party B”) regarding the sale/purchase of the Product under the terms and conditions as follows: Seller: Party A Buyer: Party B Product: [] Into _________________, Seller’s Daily Choice [] Firm (LD) [] Firm (No Force Majeure) [] System Firm (Specify System: ) [] Unit Firm (Specify Unit(s): ) [X] Other: Firm Capacity and Energy. Contract Quantity: Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements Delivery Point: Liberty Substation; City of Liberty, Texas; Liberty County Contract Price: Capacity Payment plus Fuel Payment, both payable monthly in arrears; provided, however, that the Contract Price shall not exceed the "Charges for Service" calculated pursuant to Attachment B – Rates for Service of Seller's FERC Electric Tariff No. 2 effective February 27, 2005 attached hereto as Exhibit A. Capacity Payment: For any Month, (a) if during any hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is less than 138 kilovolts, an amount equal to the product of (i) 1.015 multiplied by (ii) the sum of (A) (1) 100% of the Contract Capacity for such Month multiplied by (2) $9,250/MW and (B) (1) 15% of the Contract Capacity for such Month multiplied by (2) $275/MW or (b) if during each hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is 138 kilovolts or greater, an amount equal to the sum of (i) (A) 100% of the Contract Capacity for such Month multiplied by (B) $9,250/MW and (ii) (A) 15% of the Contract Capacity for such Month multiplied by (B) $ 275/MW. Fuel Payment: For any Month, an amount equal to the aggregate of the Daily Fuel Payments for all the days of such Month. Other Charges: N/A Delivery Period: Beginning (a) Hour Ending ("HE") 0100 on the first day of the Month immediately following the Month in which Party B has installed equipment capable of producing telemetered signals reflecting the load measured at the Boomerang Meter (i) on a continuous basis, (ii) as a half-hourly digital MWh reading, and (iii) on an individual Boomerang Meter or combined basis as reasonably required by Seller in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices and ending (b) HE 2400 on the earlier to occur of (i) the Long-Term Delivery Period Commencement Date and (ii) April 30, 2011, Central Prevailing Time ("CPT") Monday through Sunday, including NERC holidays. Special Conditions: See "Additional Provisions". Scheduling: Subject to the provisions of the Entergy OATT, Buyer shall pay Seller for and Seller will act as Buyer's agent in obtaining and scheduling transmission service, including ancillary services (except for imbalance services which shall be provided as set forth in the Additional Provisions), for all Power purchased and received from Seller pursuant to this Transaction provided that such transmission is on the Entergy System. Option Buyer: N/A Option Seller: N/A Type of Option: N/A Strike Price: N/A Premium: N/A Exercise Period: N/A
Additional Provisions: I. Definitions: The following defined terms shall be applicable to the Transaction evidenced by this confirmation letter: "Boomerang Facility" means the steel pipe and tube production facility owned by Boomerang Tube, L.L.C. located at 1100 FM 3361, Liberty, Texas 77575. "Boomerang Load" means, for any period, the total Energy that Liberty requires to serve the Boomerang Retail Contract measured at the Boomerang Meter. "Boomerang Meter" means the meter installed by Liberty at or near the Delivery Point to measure the Boomerang Load. "Boomerang Retail Contract" means that certain Retail Power Purchase Agreement dated on or about the date hereof between Liberty and Boomerang Tube, L.L.C., as amended from time to time. "Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements" means, for any period, the total Power required by Buyer to supply Liberty with Power to serve the Boomerang Load during such period; provided that, Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements shall not exceed the then-applicable Maximum Power Requirements. "Buyer's Hourly Demand" means, for any hour, the sum of the MWh of Energy delivered by Seller to Buyer at each Delivery Point during such hour; provided that, in no event shall the Buyer's Hourly Demand for any hour exceed the Maximum Contract Demand applicable during such hour. "Buyer's Peak Demand" means, for any Month prior to May 1, 2011, the greater of (a) seventy percent (70%) of the largest Buyer's Hourly Demand during any hour during the Off-Peak Period during such Month and (b) one hundred percent (100%) of the largest Buyer's Hourly Demand during any hour during the On-Peak Period during such Month, and for any Month after April 30, 2011, the largest Buyer's Hourly Demand during any hour during such Month. "Contract Capacity" means, for any Month, a quantity of capacity (expressed in MW) equal to the Buyer's Peak Demand for such Month. "Daily Fuel Payment" means, for any day, (a) if during any hour of such day the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is less than 138 kilovolts, an amount equal to (i) 1.015 multiplied by (ii) the total MWh of Energy delivered to Buyer by Seller hereunder during such day multiplied by (iii) the Fuel Rate for such day, or (b) if during each hour of such day the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is 138 kilovolts or greater, an amount equal to (i) the total MWh of Energy delivered to Buyer by Seller hereunder during such day multiplied by (ii) the Fuel Rate for such day. "Energy" means the electric energy measured in MWh. "Fuel Rate" means, for any day, an amount equal to (a) 6.95 multiplied by (b) the sum of (i) the Midpoint Price expressed in $/MMBtu for delivery for such day listed for Louisiana Onshore South: Henry Hub as published in Platt's Gas Daily Market Report under the heading "Daily Price Survey" (or its successor publication) plus (ii) $0.05/MMBtu. "Entergy OATT" means the Open Access Transmission Tariff of ESI, as agent for the Entergy Operating Companies, as amended from time to time. "Entergy Operating Companies" mean Entergy Texas, Inc., Entergy Arkansas, Inc., Entergy Louisiana, LLC, Entergy Mississippi, Inc., Entergy Gulf States Louisiana, L.L.C., and Entergy New Orleans, Inc. "Entergy System" means the interconnected, coordinated, electric utility systems of the Entergy Operating Companies that provide retail and wholesale electric service to Entergy customers. "Entergy Transmission Balancing Authority" means ESI, acting as agent for the Entergy Operating Companies, or any successor entity from time to time in control of the physical operation of and responsible for fulfilling the duties to operate the relevant balancing authority area. "ESI" means Entergy Services, Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of Delaware. "Liberty" means the City of Liberty, Texas. "Long-Term Delivery Period Commencement Date" means the "Delivery Period Commencement Date" as defined in the SRMPA Full Requirements Power Supply Agreement for City of Liberty/Boomerang Load dated as of the date hereof between Seller and Buyer. "Maximum Contract Capacity" means, for each Month during the Delivery Period, a quantity of capacity equal to 35 MW, or, upon request by Buyer, such greater amount not to exceed 40 MW (which increase shall be effective when Seller receives written notice from Buyer). "Maximum Contract Demand" means, for any hour during the Delivery Period, 35 MWh, as adjusted to account for any adjustments to the Maximum Contract Capacity. "Maximum Power Requirements" means (a) with respect to electric energy, the Maximum Contract Demand and (b) with respect to electric capacity, the Maximum Contract Capacity. "Month" means a calendar month. "MW" means a megawatt, a unit of electrical capacity or demand equal to one million watts or one thousand kilowatts. "MWh" means a megawatt-hour, a unit of electrical energy equal to one MW delivered for one hour. "Network Transmission Agreement" means both (a) the Service Agreement for Network Integration Transmission Service dated August 6, 2009 between ESI, acting as agent for the Entergy Operating Companies, and Seller attached hereto as Exhibit C and (b) the Short-Term Firm Point-to-Point Transmission Service Agreement dated June 8, 2010 between ESI, acting as agent for the Entergy Operating Companies, and Seller attached hereto as Exhibit D, as each such agreement may be amended from time to time. "Off-Peak Period" means all other hours of a week exclusive of the On-Peak Period. "On-Peak Period" means the period commencing with HE 0900 CPT through HE 2400 CPT Monday through Friday, excluding NERC holidays. "Power" means electric capacity or demand measured in MW and electric energy measured in MWh. "Prudent Industry Practice" means any of the practices, methods, techniques, standards and acts required, or approved from time to time by a significant portion of the electric power industry in the geographic region covered by the Entergy System, or any of the practices, methods, techniques, standards, and acts which, in the exercise of reasonable judgment in light of the facts known at the time the decision was made, could have been expected to accomplish the desired result at a reasonable cost consistent with applicable laws, good business practices, reliability, safety, and expedition. "Prudent Industry Practice" is not intended to be limited to the optimum practice, method or act to the exclusion of all others, but rather to be practices, methods or acts generally accepted from time to time by a significant portion of the electric power industry in the geographic region covered by the Entergy System. "RPSA" means that certain Requirements Power Sales Agreement dated as of November 1, 1998, which was partially assigned by Buyer to Vinton Public Power Authority ("VPPA") pursuant to that certain Assignment and Assumption Agreement dated effective as of July 25, 2002, among Seller, Buyer, VPPA, Entergy Corporation, Entergy-Koch Trading LP, and Entergy Power, Inc., as partially assigned and as amended or otherwise modified from time to time. "Transmission Energy Imbalance Charges" means the charges assessed as a result of deviations between Energy scheduled for transmission and Energy delivered or received or between Energy delivered and Energy received (however named, including, without limitation, energy imbalances, oversupply imbalances, or undersupply imbalances). "Transmission Energy Imbalance Credits" means payments or credits received or issued as a result of deviations between Energy scheduled for transmission and Energy delivered or received or between Energy delivered and Energy received (however named, including, without limitation, energy imbalances, oversupply imbalances, or undersupply imbalances). II. Amendments to Master Agreement. For this Transaction only, the following amendments to the Master Agreement shall apply: Article One is amended as follows: Section 1.23 is amended by deleting the text of such section in its entirety and replacing it with the following: ""Force Majeure" means any cause beyond the control of the Party affected, including but not restricted to: (i) acts of God, (ii) acts of the public enemy or terrorists, (iii) failure or threat of failure of generating and/or transmission facilities arising from or related to an event of Force Majeure, (iv) sudden actions of the elements such as lightning, flood, earthquake, tornado, storm, fire, (v) strike, labor dispute, labor or material shortage, (vi) sabotage, (vii) actions or inactions by any governmental authority taken after the date hereof (including the adoption or change in any rule or regulation or environmental constraints lawfully imposed by such governmental authority), but only if such requirements, actions, or failures to act prevent or delay performance, and (viii) any delay, interruption, or curtailment in transmission service, or loss of transmission facilities. Force Majeure shall also mean restraints on performance imposed by court order or public authority, and actions or non-actions by, or the inability to obtain or maintain in effect the necessary authorizations from any governmental agency or authority, which by exercise of due diligence such Party could not reasonably have been expected to avoid and which by exercise of due diligence it has been unable to overcome." Section 1.45 is amended by deleting the phrase "either cash,". Article Three is amended as follows: Section 3.4 incorporated by Schedule M is deleted in its entirety and replaced with "[Intentionally deleted]". The following is added as a new Section 3.6 with the heading "Delivery Imbalances": "(a) Seller shall arrange for delivery of Power to the Delivery Points and provide scheduling and related services with the Entergy Transmission Balancing Authority. The Parties agree to use commercially reasonable efforts to comply in all material respects with the operating protocols set forth in Exhibit B. (b) Seller shall pay and shall have no right of reimbursement from Buyer for all Transmission Energy Imbalance Charges incurred in connection with all Power delivered pursuant to this Agreement. (c) Seller shall be entitled to receive all Transmission Energy Imbalance Credits granted in connection with all Power delivered pursuant to this Agreement and Buyer shall pay to Seller any such amount received by or credited to Buyer. (d) For each Month during the Delivery Period, (i) Seller shall calculate the Transmission Energy Imbalance Charges and Transmission Energy Imbalance Credits, (ii) Buyer shall be responsible for all transmission charges net of the Transmission Energy Imbalance Charges and the Transmission Energy Imbalance Credits, and (iii) Seller shall adjust the Invoice to the extent necessary to reflect the payment responsibilities of the Parties with respect to such charges and credits.". The following is added as a new Section 3.7 with the heading "Measurement": "(a) Measurement at the Boomerang Meter. All the Power delivered to the Delivery Points shall be measured at the Boomerang Meter and at the nominal voltage of 138,000 volts, unless otherwise mutually agreed upon by the Parties. Should Buyer request or the Entergy Transmission Balancing Authority require alternate or additional measurement points other than the Boomerang Meter, Seller will exercise due diligence to accommodate such request; provided that Buyer agrees to pay for any additional charges associated therewith. (b) Buyer Metering Responsibilities. Buyer will own, operate, provide and maintain all necessary metering and telemetering equipment, assume full responsibility for, and will gather, through telemetry the level of Buyer's loads at the Boomerang Meter. All costs associated with the meter readings, translations, billing costs, and any applicable administrative and general expenses shall be borne by Buyer. (c) Telemetered Signals. Buyer agrees to make available to Seller the telemetered signals reflecting the load measured at the Boomerang Meter. Such signals shall be (i) on a continuous basis; (ii) as a half-hourly digital MWh reading; and (iii) on an individual Boomerang Meter or combined basis as reasonably required by Seller in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices. (d) Accuracy of Measuring Instruments. Either Party shall have the right at any time, and from time to time, upon giving forty-eight (48) hours notice to the other Party, to have the measuring instruments used to measure the Power delivered at the Boomerang Meter tested, and if necessary, recalibrated, with the requesting Party represented at the test. The expense of any such test shall be borne by the Party requesting such test unless the measuring instruments are found to be in error in excess of plus or minus two percent (+ or – 2%); in which case, the cost of the test shall be paid by Buyer. The results of all such tests shall be provided to each Party. (e) Inaccuracy Allowances. Any meter tested and found to be accurate within plus or minus two percent (+ or – 2%) shall be considered to be within the accepted range of accuracy. If, as a result of any test, any measuring instrument is found not to register within plus or minus two percent (+ or – 2%) accuracy, the readings of such measuring instrument previously taken shall be corrected according to the percentage of inaccuracy so found for the previous billing month; provided, however, if the date the measuring instrument inaccuracy began can be established, the correction shall apply retroactively to such date, but in no event shall the correction period apply beyond (i) the date that is ninety (90) days prior to the date on which the written request for a test was made or (ii) the date such measuring instrument was last tested, whichever is the shorter period. Seller shall bill or credit Buyer (as appropriate) for any billing adjustments for such inaccuracies. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, no correction for metering instrument inaccuracies will be made on any Invoice unless a Party shall request such correction in writing within ninety (90) days from the date of the Invoice. (f) Estimate for Non-registry of Meter. If a meter fails to register at any time during any month, the Parties shall, as soon as practicable and on the basis of procedures to be mutually agreed by the Parties, estimate the Power delivered during such month on the basis of the best available data considering the actual Power delivered to the Boomerang Meter under substantially similar operating conditions when the metering devices were registering accurately. (g) Condition of Equipment. The Parties agree not to injure or tamper with and to take all reasonable steps to prevent employees or other persons from injuring or tampering with the other Party's property, including but not limited to transformers, meters and other electrical equipment. The Parties agree to install and maintain in a thoroughly safe and efficient manner, and in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices and all applicable lawful regulations, their respective lines, wiring, apparatus, machinery, or appliances. If any lines, wiring, apparatus, machinery, or appliances are in a condition which interferes with a Party's proper service to another Party or to its customers, that Party shall have the right, in addition to any other right of discontinuance hereunder, to discontinue service until such interfering parts shall be put back in proper operating condition, or shall have been replaced or disconnected. Except in cases of emergency, a Party shall give the other Party reasonable written notice of its intention to discontinue service on account of any such claimed interference, and, when practical, suitable time for repair or the replacement of such interfering part. No Party assumes the duty of inspecting any other Party's lines, wiring, apparatus, machinery, or appliances, or any part thereof. (h) Network Transmission Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event that any of the terms and provisions of the Network Transmission Agreement conflict with any terms and provisions of Section 3.7(a) through (f), the terms or provisions of the Network Transmission Agreement shall govern and control for all purposes.". The following is added as a new Section 3.8 with the heading "RPSA": "The Parties acknowledge and agree their respective obligations under this Agreement may be parallel to the obligations of the Parties under the RPSA. It is the intention of the Parties that for so long as this Agreement and the Boomerang Retail Contract are both in effect Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements shall not be satisfied with Energy or capacity deliveries under the RPSA.". The following is added as a new Section 3.9 with the heading "Exclusivity": "Buyer acknowledges and agrees that this Agreement constitutes an exclusive arrangement between the Parties with respect to Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements, and that Buyer shall not procure any Power or related services from any Person other than Seller in order to serve any portion of Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements; provided that, to the extent Seller fails to deliver Power it is required to deliver hereunder, Buyer may (in the ordinary course of business and to the extent the same does not constitute an effort to avoid the exclusive supply arrangement hereunder) purchase Power from a third party. Any failure by Buyer to comply with the foregoing exclusive supply arrangement shall constitute an Event of Default hereunder with respect to Buyer.". Article Four is amended by deleting the heading and the text of such article in their entirety and replacing them with the following: "[Intentionally deleted.]" Article Five is amended as follows: Section 5.1(c) is amended by deleting the phrase ", and except for such Party's obligations to deliver or receive the Product, the exclusive remedy for which is provided in Article Four". Section 5.1 is amended by adding a new subsection (i) to read as follows: "With respect to Buyer only, it fails to comply with Section 3.9 or there is otherwise a default with respect to Buyer under Section 3.9.". Section 5.2 is amended by deleting the heading and text of such section in their entirety and replacing them with the following: "Remedies Upon an Event of Default; Termination. If an Event of Default with respect to a Defaulting Party has occurred and is continuing, the other Party (the "Non-Defaulting Party") may, upon written notice to the Defaulting Party, do any one or more of the following: (i) designate a day, no earlier than the tenth day after such notice to the Defaulting Party is effective, on which this Agreement shall terminate ("Early Termination Date"), provided that such termination is subject to any applicable notice period to FERC as required by applicable law; (ii) accelerate all amounts owing between the Parties; (iii) withhold any payments due to the Defaulting Party under this Agreement or, if an Event of Default with respect to Buyer has occurred, suspend deliveries of Energy under this Agreement; (iv) take any of the following actions: (A) exercise any of the rights and remedies of a Secured Party with respect to all Performance Assurance, including any such rights and remedies under applicable law then in effect; (B) exercise its rights of setoff against any and all property of the Defaulting Party in the possession of the Non-Defaulting Party or its agent; (C) draw on any outstanding Letter of Credit issued for its benefit; or (D) liquidate all Performance Assurance then held by or for the benefit of the Non-Defaulting Party free from any claim or right of any nature whatsoever of the Defaulting Party, including any equity or right of purchase or redemption by the Defaulting Party; or (v) exercise such other remedies may be available at law or in equity, subject however to the limitations on remedies and damages described in this Agreement. The proceeds of the collateral realized upon the exercise of the rights and remedies described in subsections (iv) above shall be used to reduce the Defaulting Party’s obligations under this Agreement (the Defaulting Party remaining liable for any amounts owing to the Non-Defaulting Party after such application), subject to the Non-Defaulting Party’s obligation to return any surplus proceeds remaining after such obligations are satisfied in full. In the event that an Early Termination Date is designated, the Parties shall continue to invoice, credit, and pay for Energy previously delivered and neither Party shall be relieved by such termination of any obligation incurred or arising prior to the Early Termination Date. If this Agreement is terminated pursuant to this Section 5.2, Seller is entitled to recovery of costs reasonably incurred by Seller in unwinding any arrangement pursuant to which it has hedged its obligations under this Agreement.". Section 5.3 is amended by deleting the heading and text of such section in their entirety and replacing them with the following: "Set-Off. If an Event of Default occurs, the Non-Defaulting Party may at its election set off any or all amounts which the Defaulting Party owes it, whether under this Agreement or otherwise and whether or not then due, against any and all amounts which it owes to the Defaulting Party, whether under this Agreement or otherwise and whether or not then due, provided that any amount not then due which is included in such set off shall be discounted to present value in a commercially reasonable manner. The remedy provided for in this Section 5.3 shall be without prejudice and in addition to any right of setoff, combination of accounts, lien or other right to which any Party is at any time otherwise entitled (whether by operation of law, contract or otherwise).". Sections 5.4, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 are each amended by deleting the heading and the text of such sections in their entirety and replacing them with the following: "[Intentionally deleted.]". Article Six is amended as follows: The heading of Article Six shall be deleted and replaced with "BILLING AND PAYMENT". Section 6.1 is amended by deleting the heading and the text of such section in their entirety and replacing them with the following: "Monthly Invoices. Seller shall use reasonable efforts to render to Buyer on or before the fifteenth (15th) day of each Month during the Delivery Period an invoice for services provided hereunder during the previous Month (an "Invoice"); provided that, failure to provide an Invoice in a timely manner shall not affect Buyer's obligation to make a payment in accordance with Section 6.2 following receipt thereof. Such Invoice shall set forth the Monthly Capacity Payment, the Monthly Fuel Payment, any charges for transmission and distribution services, and any other payment obligations accrued by one Party to the other during the applicable Month under this Agreement, which Seller shall net into a single amount owing from one Party to the other.". Section 6.2 is amended by deleting the heading and the text of such section in their entirety and replacing them with the following: "Payment. Buyer shall make payment of the amount set forth on the Invoice on or before twenty (20) days after the date such Invoice is received. Buyer shall make payment in immediately available funds to the bank account designated in writing by Seller.". Section 6.3 is amended by deleting the heading and the text of such section in their entirety and replacing them with the following: "Late Charges. Amounts due by either Party under this Agreement but not paid on or before the applicable due date thereof shall be payable with interest accrued at lesser of (a) the "Prime Rate" for domestic banks as published in The Wall Street Journal in the "Money Rates" section on the last Business Day of the Month in which service was required plus five hundred basis points and (b) the maximum rate permitted by applicable law. Such interest shall accrue daily from the due date until the date upon which payment is made.". Section 6.4 is amended by deleting the heading and the text of such section in their entirety and replacing them with the following: "Billing Disputes. If Buyer, in good-faith, disputes the correctness of any Invoice, Buyer shall pay the undisputed amount and submit to Seller a detailed written explanation of the basis for the dispute. The Parties shall use their best efforts to attempt to resolve such disputes through negotiation on a timely basis. Upon determination of the correct Invoice amount, Buyer shall promptly pay the adjusted Invoice with the interest accrued in accordance with Section 6.3 and computed from the original due date to the date the adjustment is made. ". Sections 6.5, 6.6, 6.7 and 6.8 are each amended by deleting the heading and the text of such section in their entirety and replacing them with the following: "[Intentionally deleted.]". Article Eight is amended as follows: Section 8.1 is amended by deleting from the introductory paragraph the following sentence: "If no option in Section 8.1(a) is specified on the Cover Sheet, Section 8.1(a) Option C shall apply exclusively." and deleting 8.1(a), 8.1(c) and 8.1(d) in their entirety and replacing them with the following "[Not Applicable]". Section 8.2 is amended by deleting from the introductory paragraph the following sentence: "If no option in Section 8.2(a) is specified on the Cover Sheet, Section 8.2(a) Option C shall apply exclusively." and deleting 8.2(a), 8.2(c) and 8.2(d) in their entirety and replacing them with the following "[Not Applicable]". Section 8.3 is amended by deleting the second and third sentences of Section 8.3 in their entirety. Article Ten is amended as follows: Section 10.5 is amended by deleting the words "may be withheld in the exercise of its sole discretion" and replacing them with "shall not be unreasonably withheld". Section 10.6 is amended by deleting the words "New York" and replacing them with "Texas". Section 10.11 is amended by inserting the word "voluntarily" after the word "shall" and before the word "disclose" in the first sentence thereof. The following is added as a new Section 10.12 with the heading "Venue and Jurisdiction": "For the purposes of initiating any legal action or proceeding arising under or relating to this Agreement or for recognition or enforcement of any judgment therefrom each Party expressly agrees to file its complaint exclusively in the State or Federal Courts located in Harris County, Texas. Each Party consents to exclusive jurisdiction and venue in Harris County, Texas and agrees to waive any objection to these forums (including, but not limited to, any venue or forum non conveniens grounds) and each Party waives the right to transfer venue from the State or Federal Courts located in Harris County. Each of the Parties agree that a final judgment in any such action or proceeding may be enforced in other jurisdictions by suit on the judgment or in any other manner provided by applicable law.". The following is added as a new Section 10.13 with the heading "Relationship of the Parties": "The relationship of the Parties is that of independent contractors. The Parties are not, by virtue of this Agreement or otherwise, in an employer-employee, principal-agent, joint venture, or partnership relationship with each other.". Schedule M is amended by deleting clauses (v) and (vi) from the additional representations and warranties added to Section 10.2 and replacing clause (v) with the following: "(v) the Public Power System's obligations to make payments hereunder are operating and maintenance costs (or similar designation) under any and all bond ordinances or indentures to which it is a party, " and by replacing "(vii)" with "(vi)". Schedule P: PRODUCTS AND RELATED DEFINITIONS is amended by deleting from the definition of " Firm Transmission Contingent - Delivery Point" the following phrase: ", and no damages shall be payable including any amounts determined pursuant to Article Four,".

In the future, to reduce effort and the possibility of errors, EAM may at its discretion provide an alternative means for SRMPA or it’s Designee to enter it’s nomination directly into EAM’s computer system.

EAM’s Agent shall be:
Physical Systems Integration, LLC 105 W. Main St, Suite C Allen, Tx 75013 Office : 469 675 3652 or 469-892-8290
2001 Timberloch Place 1st Floor South The Woodlands, Tx 77350 Office : 281-259-5406
For changes between the hours of 5:00 pm CPT and 6:00 am CPT, and on weekend days and holidays, SRMPA or its Designee will notify the Power Marketer (ML 24 hour desk) by electronic mail with a confirmatory email and telephone call to support@psisoft.net 469 675 3652 or 469-892-8290__________________________________________.
Intra-day Procedures
SRMPA or its Designee will update the current day’s Estimated Demand Schedule on a four hour basis ahead of any schedule changes --unless otherwise agreed. Any schedules and schedule changes for the Boomerang Load power requirements shall be noticed to EAM’s Agent by SRMPA or its Designee through electronic mail with a confirmatory concurrent telephone call.
In the event that SRMPA or its Designee becomes aware of an event or circumstance that has an effect on the Intra-Day or current Estimated Demand Schedule:
SRMPA or its Designee shall promptly inform EAM’s agent and Designees of any expected changes to the information in the Estimated Demand Schedule.
EAM’s agent and Designees will use reasonable commercial efforts to accommodate the requested modification.
EAM or EAM's Agent will include SRMPA’s Direct Contract power requirements in the overall SRMPA requirements.
Business Day is defined as M-F, with weekend days and holidays excepted.
Meters / Meter Data :
Real time metering is a requirement. Maintenance of meters will be the responsibility of SRMPA.

See attached.
Exhibit D – Short-Term Firm Point-to-Point Transmission Service Agreement
See attached.

record_data.record_title: Cost Based Rate Tariff - RS Cogen
record_data.record_plain_text:
Second Revised Vol No 2 Cost Based Rate Tariff - RS Cogen EWO Marketing, LLC Second Revised Vol. No. 2 Cost-Based Rate Tariff RS Cogen
1.0 Definitions
1.1 "Business Day" means any day except a Saturday, Sunday or a Federal Reserve Bank holiday.
1.2 "Buyer" means the party to a Transaction that purchases and receives, or causes to be received, wholesale electric capacity and/or energy under this Tariff.
1.3 "Central Prevailing Time" or "CPT" means Central Daylight Time during the time of the year that Daylight Savings Time is in effect in Louisiana, and means Central Standard Time during the remaining time of the year.
1.4 "EWO Marketing" means EWO Marketing, LLC
1.5 "FERC" means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or any successor government agency.
1.6 "Master Agreement" means the Master Power Purchase and Sale Agreement prepared by a committee of representatives of Edison Electric Institute and the National Energy Marketers Association to facilitate orderly trading and the development of wholesale power markets. The Master Agreement referenced in this Tariff is Version 2.1 modified on April 25, 2000 as such Master Agreement may be subsequently amended from time to time.
1.7 "Seller" means EWO Marketing.
1.8 "Service Agreement" means the agreement entered into by Seller and Buyer for service under this Tariff, as such agreement may be amended from time to time and in the form set forth as Appendix C hereto.
1.9 "Tariff" means EWO Marketing's FERC Electric Tariff No. 2.
1.10 "Transaction" means a particular transaction agreed to by the parties relating to the wholesale sale of capacity and/or energy pursuant to and in accordance with the Service Schedules attached to this Tariff.
2.0 Customers Served: This Tariff applies to capacity and/or energy sold from the RS Cogen cogeneration facility to load within Entergy's control area. Prior to taking service under this Tariff, customers must first execute a Service Agreement
3.0 Transmission: Arrangements for transmission service required for Transaction hereunder shall be made separately under applicable Open Access Transmission Tariffs (OATTs). Unless otherwise agreed for a given Transaction, the Buyer shall have the responsibility for obtaining or providing transmission service and shall bear all costs associated with such transmission service. If Seller arranges for any such transmission, at the request of Buyer, Buyer will reimburse Seller for any transmission costs incurred in provide the service. Seller shall have the right to receive assurances satisfactory to it that all necessary transmission arrangements are in place prior to committing to any Transaction pursuant to this Tariff.
4.0 Availability: Seller will determine, in its sole discretion, the amount and times that capacity and energy will be made available under this Tariff prior to entering into a Transaction. All Transactions under this Tariff shall be voluntary on the part of both Buyer and Seller. By executing a Service Agreement with any Buyer, Seller does not warrant that it has any capacity and/or energy available for sale hereunder and does not commit to enter into any individual Transaction. A Buyer that executes a Service Agreement with Seller does not commit to enter into any individual Transaction with Seller. All arrangements for Transactions provided hereunder shall be made between operating representatives of Seller and Buyer.
5.0 Terms of a Transaction: Seller shall document the starting time and date, price, duration, quantity, delivery point and description of service provided for each Transaction.
6.0 Negotiated Capacity and Energy: Negotiated Capacity and Energy is defined as the wholesale capacity and energy that Seller agrees to sell and Buyer agrees to purchase for a given Transaction for services of greater than 1 week but less than one year. The maximum rates and terms for Negotiated Capacity and Energy are set out in Attachment B, as such Attachment may be amended from time to time.
7.0 Short Term Energy: Short Term Energy is defined as wholesale non-firm energy that Seller agrees to sell and Buyer agrees to purchase for a given Transaction for services of one week or less. The maximum rates and terms for Short Term Energy are set out in Attachment B, as such Attachment may be amended from time to time.
8.0 Rate Changes: Nothing herein shall be construed in any way as affecting the rights of the Seller to unilaterally make an application to FERC under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to FERC's rules and regulations to change the general terms and conditions and/or rates set out in this Tariff. Any such changes shall become effective as authorized by FERC.
9.0 Cancellation of Tariff: Seller shall have the unilateral right to cancel this Tariff at any time by filing with the FERC a notice of cancellation; provided, however, that unless otherwise agreed by the parties, any Transaction agreed to prior to the date that this Tariff is canceled shall continue through the previously agreed-to term of such Transaction, and the terms and conditions of this Tariff shall be deemed in force for the duration of any such Transaction.
10.0 Expansion of Facilities: Seller will have no obligation under this Tariff or any Service Agreement executed hereunder to plan its system or modify its facilities or acquire additional resources in order to provide service hereunder.
11.0 Other Information: Seller may request such other information as it determines may reasonable be required to enter into a Service Agreement or to agree to a Transaction and perform its obligation thereunder. Buyer shall be obligated to provide on a timely basis such information requested by Seller.
12.0 Cancellation of Service Agreement and/or Transaction: Seller reserves the right to cancel the Service Agreement between Seller and Buyer and/or terminate Transactions under the Service Agreement.
13.0 No Liability for Curtailment: Unless otherwise explicitly agreed upon for a specific Transaction, Seller shall have no liability for, and Buyer shall be deemed to have released Seller from, any liability, costs, damages or other expenses that Buyer may incur as a result of the interruption or curtailment of a Transaction arranged under this Tariff.
14.0 Resumption: In those instances in which a Transaction has been curtailed, unless otherwise agreed by the parties, the Transaction shall be resumed as soon as reasonably practical as determined by Seller on the same terms and conditions as previously agreed to for such Transaction.
15.0 Regulatory Approval: The provisions of this Tariff are subject to the regulatory authority of the FERC. In order for a Buyer to take service under this Tariff, a Service Agreement must be executed by Seller and Buyer and returned to Seller. Seller must receive an executed Service Agreement from Buyer prior to providing service under this Tariff. Seller may require Buyer to provide requested contact information, credit assurance or any other information reasonably required by Seller to provide service under this Tariff or to comply with any regulatory requirements.
16.0 Notices: Any notice, demand or request required or authorized by this Tariff shall be deemed properly given if delivered as specified in the Master Agreement.
17.0 No Dedication of Facilities: Any undertaking or commitment by one party to the other under any provision of this Tariff shall not constitute the dedication of such party's facilities to the public, any third person or the other party.
18.0 Affiliate Power Sales: Seller will not enter into any Transaction with any affiliate without first receiving Commission authorization of the Transaction under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act.
Service Schedule A Negotiated Capacity and Energy
1. Conditions of Service
a. Negotiated Capacity and Energy will be provided with a level of firmness as negotiated between the Buyer and Seller for each Transaction.
b. The term of a Negotiated Capacity and Energy Transaction can be from greater than one week to less than one year.
2. Maximum Negotiated Rate
Buyer shall pay Seller for the Negotiated Capacity and Energy supplied at the negotiated price, which shall not exceed the price included in Attachment B hereto.
Service Schedule B Short Term Energy
1. Conditions of Service
a. Short Term Energy is nonfirm and, unless otherwise agreed to for a given Transaction, may be curtailed by the Seller for any reason.
b. The term of a Short Term Energy Transaction may be from one hour to one week.
2. Maximum Negotiated Rate
Buyer shall pay Seller for Short Term Energy supplied at the negotiated price, which shall not exceed the price included in Attachment B hereto.
ATTACHMENT A
Master Power Purchase & Sale Agreement
