-27- srmpa FULL requirements power supply AGREEMENT for city of liberty/boomerang load THIS SRMPA FULL REQUIREMENTS POWER SUPPLY AGREEMENT FOR CITY OF LIBERTY/BOOMERANG LOAD (this "Agreement") is entered into as of June ___, 2010 (the "Execution Date"), by and between EWO MARKETING, INC., a Delaware corporation ("Seller"), and SAM RAYBURN MUNICIPAL POWER AUTHORITY, a political subdivision of the State of Texas ("Buyer"). Buyer and Seller may be individually referred to herein as a "Party" and, collectively, as the "Parties". WHEREAS, Seller (as successor to Entergy Power Marketing Corporation by assignment) and Buyer are parties to that certain Requirements Power Sales Agreement dated as of November 1, 1998, which was partially assigned by Buyer to Vinton Public Power Authority ("VPPA") pursuant to that certain Assignment and Assumption Agreement dated effective as of July 25, 2002, among Seller, Buyer, VPPA, Entergy Corporation, Entergy-Koch Trading LP, and Entergy Power, Inc. (as partially assigned and as amended or otherwise modified from time to time, the "RPSA"); WHEREAS, pursuant to the RPSA, Buyer purchases electric energy from Seller to supply to its members, the Cities of Jasper, Liberty ("Liberty") and Livingston, Texas; WHEREAS, Liberty and Boomerang Tube, L.L.C. ("Boomerang") are parties to the certain Retail Power Purchase Agreement (the "Boomerang Retail Contract") dated on or about the date hereof pursuant to which Liberty will provide Boomerang with all electrical loads up to 35 MW, or upon request of Buyer such greater amount not to exceed 40 MW, required by Boomerang to operate its steel pipe and tube production facility located at 1100 FM 3361, Liberty, Texas 77575 (the "Boomerang Facility"); and WHEREAS, Buyer and Seller desire to enter into this agreement, parallel to the RPSA, for Buyer to purchase electric energy from Seller so that Buyer may supply Liberty with the electric energy that Liberty needs to satisfy its obligations under the Boomerang Retail Contract. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and agreements set forth herein and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties hereby agree as follows: DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION Certain Defined Terms. As used herein, the following terms shall have the following meanings: "Affiliate" means, with respect to any Person, any other Person (other than an individual) that, directly or indirectly, through one or more intermediaries, controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with, such Person. For this purpose, "control" means the direct or indirect ownership of more than fifty percent (50%) of the outstanding capital stock, limited liability company, partnership, or other equity interests having ordinary voting power. "Agreement" has the meaning set forth in the preamble to this Agreement. "Approvals" means all approvals, permits, licenses, consents, waivers or other authorizations from, notifications to, or filings or registrations with, governmental authorities or other third parties. "Boomerang" has the meaning set forth in the recitals to this Agreement. "Boomerang Facility" has the meaning set forth in the recitals to this Agreement. "Boomerang Load" means, for any period, the total Energy that Liberty requires to serve the Boomerang Retail Contract measured at the Boomerang Meter. "Boomerang Meter" means the meter installed by Liberty at or near the Delivery Point to measure the Boomerang Load. "Boomerang Retail Contract" has the meaning set forth in the recitals to this Agreement. "Business Day" means any day other than a day that is a Saturday, Sunday or legal holiday in the State of Texas. "Buyer" has the meaning set forth in the preamble to this Agreement. "Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements" means, for any period, the total Power required by Buyer to supply Liberty with Power to serve the Boomerang Load during such period; provided that, Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements shall not exceed the then-applicable Maximum Power Requirements. "Buyer's Hourly Demand" means, for any hour, the sum of the MWh of Energy delivered by Seller to Buyer at each Delivery Point during such hour; provided that, in no event shall the Buyer's Hourly Demand for any hour exceed the Maximum Contract Demand applicable during such hour. "Buyer's Peak Demand" means, for any Month prior to May 1, 2011, the greater of (a) seventy percent (70%) of the largest Buyer's Hourly Demand during any hour during the Off-Peak Period during such Month and (b) one hundred percent (100%) of the largest Buyer's Hourly Demand during any hour during the On-Peak Period during such Month, and for any Month after April 30, 2011, the largest Buyer's Hourly Demand during any hour during such Month. "Buyer's Renewable Energy" has the meaning set forth in Section 3.1(d). "Claims" means all claims or actions filed by a Person other than a Party, and whether groundless, false or fraudulent, that directly or indirectly relate to the subject matter of an indemnity, and the resulting losses, damages, expenses, attorney's fees and court costs, whether incurred by settlement or otherwise, and whether such claims or actions are filed prior to or after the termination of this Agreement. "Central Prevailing Time" or "CPT" means the prevailing time on any given day in Houston, Texas. "Contract Capacity" means, for any Month, a quantity of capacity (expressed in MW) equal to the greater of (a) Buyer's Peak Demand for such Month and (b) the largest Buyer's Peak Demand for the eleven (11) Month period immediately preceding such Month, provided, that such period shall not include any Month prior to May 1, 2011; provided, however, if in any Month Buyer elects pursuant to Section 3.1(b) for the Maximum Contract Capacity to remain the then-applicable Maximum Contract Capacity rather than being reduced to the then-applicable Reduced Contract Capacity, the Contract Capacity shall be equal to the then-applicable Maximum Contract Capacity until the Maximum Contract Capacity is otherwise reduced pursuant to Section 3.1(b). "Cost Based Contract Capacity Rate" means, for each Month, the monthly charge for Contract Capacity expressed in $/MW-month as set forth in Exhibit B under the heading "RS Cogen Cost Based Contract Capacity Rate", as modified from time to time as provided in Section 4.2(a)(iv). "Cost Based Energy Rate" means, for each Month, the charge for Energy expressed in $/MWh as calculated as set forth in Exhibit B under the heading "RS Cogen Cost Based Energy Rate", as modified from time to time as provided in Section 4.2(a)(iv). "Cost Based Fuel Rate" means, for each Month, the charge for fuel expressed in $/MWh as calculated as set forth in Exhibit B under the heading "RS Cogen Cost Based Fuel Rate", as modified from time to time as provided in Section 4.2(a)(iv). "Cost Based Monthly Capacity Payment" means, for any Month, (a) if during any hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is less than 138 kilovolts, an amount equal to the sum of (i) the Reserve Capacity Payment for such Month plus (ii) (A) 101.5% of the Contract Capacity for such Month multiplied by (B) the Cost Based Contract Capacity Rate for such Month or (b) if during each hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is 138 kilovolts or greater, an amount equal to the sum of (i) the Reserve Capacity Payment for such Month plus (ii) (A) the Contract Capacity for such Month multiplied by (B) the Cost Based Contract Capacity Rate for such Month. "Cost Based Monthly Energy Payment" means, for any Month, (a) if during any hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is less than 138 kilovolts, an amount equal to (i) 1.015 multiplied by (ii) the total MWh of Energy delivered to Buyer by Seller hereunder during such Month multiplied by (iii) the Cost Based Energy Rate for such Month or (b) if during each hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is 138 kilovolts or greater, an amount equal to (i) the total MWh of Energy delivered to Buyer by Seller hereunder during such Month multiplied by (ii) the Cost Based Energy Rate for such Month. "Cost Based Monthly Fuel Payment" means, for any Month, (a) if during any hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is less than 138 kilovolts, an amount equal to (i) 1.015 multiplied by (ii) the total MWh of Energy delivered to Buyer by Seller hereunder during such Month multiplied by (iii) the Cost Based Fuel Rate for such Month or (b) if during each hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is 138 kilovolts or greater, an amount equal to (i) the total MWh of Energy delivered to Buyer by Seller hereunder during such Month multiplied by (ii) the Cost Based Fuel Rate for such Month. "Cost Based Rates" has the meaning set forth in Section 4.2(a)(iv). "Defaulting Party" has the meaning set forth in Section 8.1. "Delivery Period" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.2. "Delivery Period Commencement Date" means the first day of the Month immediately following the Month in which all the conditions set forth in Section 2.3(a) have either been satisfied or waived by the Party for whose benefit such conditions exist, or at such other time as the Parties may mutually agree. "Delivery Point(s)" means the point(s), as listed on Exhibit A, and any additions or modifications thereto as may be agreed upon from time to time by the Parties, at which deliveries of Power under this Agreement are required to be made and metered. "Designated Resources" means RS Cogen, Ritchie 2 or such other power generation facilities or replacement power purchase arrangements as may be designated from time to time as Designated Resources in accordance with Section 3.1(e). "Dispute" has the meaning set forth in Section 10.1. "Dispute Notice" has the meaning set forth in Section 10.1 "Early Termination Date" has the meaning set forth in Section 8.2. "Energy" means the electric energy measured in MWh. "Entergy OATT" means the Open Access Transmission Tariff of ESI, as agent for the Entergy Operating Companies, as amended from time to time. "Entergy Operating Companies" mean Entergy Texas, Inc., Entergy Arkansas, Inc., Entergy Louisiana, LLC, Entergy Mississippi, Inc., Entergy Gulf States Louisiana, L.L.C., and Entergy New Orleans, Inc. "Entergy System" means the interconnected, coordinated, electric utility systems of the Entergy Operating Companies that provide retail and wholesale electric service to Entergy customers. "Entergy Transmission Balancing Authority" means ESI, acting as agent for the Entergy Operating Companies, or any successor entity from time to time in control of the physical operation of and responsible for fulfilling the duties to operate the relevant balancing authority area. "ESI" means Entergy Services, Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of Delaware. "Event of Default" has the meaning set forth in Section 8.1. "Execution Date" has the meaning set forth in the preamble to this Agreement. "FERC" means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or any successor agency. "Fixed Capacity Rate" means $9,250/MW. "Forced Outage" means with respect to any Designated Resource, an event that requires removal from service of all or part of such Designated Resource that does not constitute a Force Majeure or Planned Maintenance Outage. "Force Majeure" has the meaning set forth in Article 9. "Governmental Authority" means any federal, national, supranational, provincial, state, municipal, local or similar government, governmental authority, regulatory or administrative agency, governmental commission, department, board, bureau, agency or instrumentality, court, tribunal, arbitrator or arbitral body. "Imaged Agreement" has the meaning set forth in Section 11.18. "Initial Daily Fuel Payment" means, for any day, (a) if during any hour of such day the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is less than 138 kilovolts, an amount equal to (i) 1.015 multiplied by (ii) the total MWh of Energy delivered to Buyer by Seller hereunder during such day multiplied by (iii) the Initial Fuel Rate for such day, or (b) if during each hour of such day the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is 138 kilovolts or greater, an amount equal to (i) the total MWh of Energy delivered to Buyer by Seller hereunder during such day multiplied by (ii) the Initial Fuel Rate for such day. "Initial Fuel Rate" means, for any day, an amount equal to (a) 6.95 multiplied by (b) the sum of (i) the Midpoint Price expressed in $/MMBtu for delivery for such day listed for Louisiana Onshore South: Henry Hub as published in Platt's Gas Daily Market Report under the heading "Daily Price Survey" (or its successor publication) plus (ii) $0.05/MMBtu. "Initial Monthly Capacity Payment" means, for any Month, (a) if during any hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is less than 138 kilovolts, an amount equal to the product of (i) 1.015 multiplied by (ii) the sum of (A) (1) 100% of the Contract Capacity for such Month multiplied by (2) the Fixed Capacity Rate and (B) (1) 15% of the Contract Capacity for such Month multiplied by (2) the lesser of (x) the Reserve Capacity Rate and (y) $275/MW or (b) if during each hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is 138 kilovolts or greater, an amount equal to the sum of (i) (A) 100% of the Contract Capacity for such Month multiplied by (B) the Fixed Capacity Rate and (ii) (A) 15% of the Contract Capacity for such Month multiplied by (B) the lesser of (x) the Reserve Capacity Rate and (y) $275/MW. "Initial Monthly Fuel Payment" means, for any Month, an amount equal to the aggregate of the Initial Daily Fuel Payments for all the days of such Month. "Invoice" shall have the meaning set forth in Section 6.1. "Letter of Credit" means an irrevocable, standby transferable letter of credit, issued by a major U.S. commercial bank or a U.S. branch office of a foreign bank which is satisfactory to the beneficiary; where such letter of credit bank has a senior unsecured long term debt rating of "A-" or better by S&P and "A3" or better by Moody's and has a combined capital surplus of at least $10,000,000,000. "Letter of Credit Default" has the meaning set forth in Section 5.1(a). "Liberty" has the meaning set forth in the recitals of this Agreement. "Maximum Contract Capacity" means, for each Month during the Delivery Period, a quantity of capacity equal to 35 MW, or, upon request by Buyer at any time prior to a reduction to the Maximum Contract Capacity pursuant to Section 3.1(b), such greater amount not to exceed 40 MW (which increase shall be effective when Seller receives written notice of such request from Buyer), subject in all cases to reduction as set forth in Section 3.1(b). "Maximum Contract Demand" means, for any hour during the Delivery Period, 35 MWh, as adjusted to account for any adjustment to the Maximum Contract Capacity pursuant to Section 3.1(b). "Maximum Power Requirements" means (a) with respect to electric energy, the then-applicable Maximum Contract Demand and (b) with respect to electric capacity, the then-applicable Maximum Contract Capacity. "Month" means a calendar month. "Monthly Capacity Payment" means (a) for any Month during the Delivery Period prior to the Power Payment Flip Date, the Initial Monthly Capacity Payment for such Month and (b) for any Month during the Delivery Period from and after the Power Payment Flip Date, the Cost Based Monthly Capacity Payment for such Month. "Monthly Fuel Payment" means (a) for any Month during the Delivery Period prior to the Power Payment Flip Date, the Initial Monthly Fuel Payment for such Month and (b) for any Month during the Delivery Period from and after the Power Payment Flip Date, the Cost Based Monthly Fuel Payment for such Month. "Monthly Supplemental Supply Arrangement Payment" has the meaning set forth in Section 4.2(b). "Moody's" shall mean Moody's Investors Service, Inc. or its successor. "MW" means a megawatt, a unit of electrical capacity or demand equal to one million watts or one thousand kilowatts. "MWh" means a megawatt-hour, a unit of electrical energy equal to one MW delivered for one hour. "Network Transmission Agreement" means both (a) the Service Agreement for Network Integration Transmission Service dated August 6, 2009 between ESI, acting as agent for the Entergy Operating Companies, and Seller attached hereto as Exhibit D and (b) the Short-Term Firm Point-to-Point Transmission Service Agreement dated June 8, 2010 between ESI, acting as agent for the Entergy Operating Companies, and Seller attached hereto as Exhibit E, as each such agreement may be amended from time to time. "Non-Defaulting Party" has the meaning set forth in Section 8.2. "Off-Peak Period" means all other hours of a week exclusive of the On-Peak Period. "On-Peak Period" means the period commencing with hour ending 0900 CPT through hour ending 2400 CPT Monday through Friday, excluding North American Electric Reliability Corporation holidays. "Party" has the meaning set forth in the preamble to this Agreement. "Performance Assurance" has the meaning set forth in Section 5.1(a). "Person" means an individual, partnership, corporation, limited liability company, association, trust, unincorporated organization, or a government authority or agency or political subdivision thereof. "Planned Maintenance Outage" means with respect to any Designated Resource, any outage of such Designated Resource scheduled in advance by Seller due to inspection, testing, maintenance, repair, or overhaul. "Pledgor" has the meaning set forth in Section 5.2. "Power" means electric capacity or demand measured in MW and electric energy measured in MWh. "Power Payment Flip Date" means the earlier to occur of (a) the two (2) year anniversary of the Delivery Period Commencement Date or (b) the two (2) year anniversary of the first day on which Seller delivered Energy to Buyer under the short-term sales transaction entered into by and between Buyer and Seller under that certain Master Power Purchase and Sale Agreement dated effective as of the date hereof. "Prudent Industry Practice" means any of the practices, methods, techniques, standards and acts required, or approved from time to time by a significant portion of the electric power industry in the geographic region covered by the Entergy System, or any of the practices, methods, techniques, standards, and acts which, in the exercise of reasonable judgment in light of the facts known at the time the decision was made, could have been expected to accomplish the desired result at a reasonable cost consistent with applicable laws, good business practices, reliability, safety, and expedition. "Prudent Industry Practice" is not intended to be limited to the optimum practice, method or act to the exclusion of all others, but rather to be practices, methods or acts generally accepted from time to time by a significant portion of the electric power industry in the geographic region covered by the Entergy System. "Reduced Contract Capacity" means, for any day, 115% of the largest Buyer's Peak Demand for the twelve (12) Month period immediately preceding such day. "Reserve Capacity" means, for any Month, a quantity of capacity (expressed in MW) equal to (a) the Contract Capacity for that Month multiplied by (b) 0.15. "Reserve Capacity Payment" means, for any Month, (a) if during any hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is less than 138 kilovolts, an amount equal to (i) 101.5% of the Reserve Capacity for such Month multiplied by (ii) the Reserve Capacity Rate for such Month or (b) if during each hour of such Month the voltage level at the Boomerang Meter is 138 kilovolts or greater, an amount equal to (i) the Reserve Capacity for such Month multiplied by (ii) the Reserve Capacity Rate for such Month. "Reserve Capacity Rate" means, for each Month, the monthly charge for Reserve Capacity expressed in $/MW-Month as set forth in Exhibit B under the heading “Ritchie 2 Cost Based Capacity Rate,” as modified from time to time as provided in Section 4.2(a)(iv). "Ritchie 2" means the 544 MW gas and oil-fired steam electric facility located near Helena, Arkansas. "RPSA" has the meaning set forth in the recitals to this Agreement. "RPSA Termination Date" means September 30, 2021 or the earlier termination of the RPSA. "RS Cogen" means the 425 MW natural gas fired, combined cycle cogeneration project located in Lake Charles, Louisiana owned by RS Cogen LLC. "S&P" shall mean Standard & Poor's Ratings Group, a division of The McGraw-Hill Companies, Inc. or its successor. "Secured Party" has the meaning set forth in Section 5.2. "Seller" has the meaning set forth in the preamble to this Agreement. "Short-Term Replacement Arrangement" has the meaning set forth in Section 3.1(e)(ii). "Supplemental Supply Arrangement" has the meaning set forth in Section 3.1(e)(iv). "Term" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.1. "Termination Date" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.1. "Transmission Energy Imbalance Charges" means the charges assessed as a result of deviations between Energy scheduled for transmission and Energy delivered or received or between Energy delivered and Energy received (however named, including, without limitation, energy imbalances, oversupply imbalances, or undersupply imbalances). "Transmission Energy Imbalance Credits" means payments or credits received or issued as a result of deviations between Energy scheduled for transmission and Energy delivered or received or between Energy delivered and Energy received (however named, including, without limitation, energy imbalances, oversupply imbalances, or undersupply imbalances). "Transmission Provider" means ESI, acting as agent for the Entergy Operating Companies, the public utilities that own, operate and control the facilities used for the transmission of electric energy in interstate commerce. "VPPA" has the meaning set forth in the recitals to this Agreement. Interpretation; Rules of Conduct. In this Agreement: the table of contents, headings, and Article and Section numbering are for convenience only and shall be ignored in construing this Agreement; the singular includes the plural and vice versa; references to Articles, Sections, Recitals, and Exhibits are, unless the context otherwise requires, references to Articles and Sections of, and Recitals and Exhibits to, this Agreement; the Exhibits to this Agreement form a part of this Agreement; the words "hereof', "herein", "hereinafter", "hereunder", "hereby", "hereto", and similar words refer to this entire Agreement and not to any particular Article, Section, Recital, or Exhibit; the term "including" when used in this Agreement shall be by way of example only and shall not be considered in any way to be a limitation; if any payment hereunder is required to be made on a day which is not a Business Day, such payment shall be made on the next succeeding Business Day, provided that, if such next succeeding Business Day is not in the same Month as the date required for payment, such payment shall be made on the immediately preceding Business Day; and unless otherwise provided herein, whenever a consent or approval is required by one Party from the other Party, such consent or approval shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed. CONDITIONS PRECEDENT; TERM; RPSA Term. The term of this Agreement (the "Term") shall commence on the Execution Date and shall continue in effect until the earlier of (i) the RPSA Termination Date and (ii) the earlier termination of this Agreement in accordance with the terms hereof (the earliest of such dates being the "Termination Date"); provided, however, that such termination shall not affect or excuse (A) the performance of either Party under any provisions of this Agreement that by its terms survives any such termination or (B) the rights and obligations of the Parties that accrue prior to the Termination Date. Delivery Period. Subject to Section 2.3, Seller's obligation to sell and deliver the Energy and Buyer's obligation to receive and purchase the Contract Capacity and Energy pursuant to ARTICLE 3 and each of the Parties' obligation to make payments under Sections 4.1 and 4.2, shall commence at 12:00.01 a.m. CPT on the Delivery Period Commencement Date, and continue through and including midnight CPT on the Termination Date (such period being the "Delivery Period"). Conditions Precedent. The commencement of the Delivery Period is contingent upon the satisfaction of each of the following conditions precedent: Seller shall have arranged for additional transmission with Transmission Provider sufficient to allow Seller to deliver the Maximum Contract Capacity to Buyer during the first year of the Delivery Period. Seller shall have obtained approval by FERC of this Agreement, without modification (other than such modifications that are satisfactory to each Party in its sole discretion). Buyer shall have installed equipment capable of producing telemetered signals reflecting the load of the Boomerang Facility (i) on a continuous basis, (ii) as a half-hourly digital MWh reading, and (iii) on an individual Boomerang Meter or combined basis as reasonably required by Seller in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices. Seller and Buyer may mutually agree, in each of their sole discretion, to waive any condition specified in this Section 2.3(a) in writing at any time. Seller shall take all commercially reasonable efforts to satisfy the conditions set forth in Sections 2.3(a)(i) and 2.3(a)(ii) on or before June 30, 2011. Buyer, without the obligation to incur any costs, agrees to assist and cooperate with Seller in taking or doing, all things necessary, proper or advisable in attempting to satisfy such conditions precedent. Buyer shall take all commercially reasonable efforts to satisfy the conditions set forth in Section 2.3(a)(iii) on or before June 30, 2011. Seller, without the obligation to incur any costs, agrees to cooperate with Buyer in attempting to satisfy such conditions precedent. Each Party will keep the other reasonably informed regarding its progress in satisfying the conditions precedent. Seller will promptly notify Buyer in writing upon the satisfaction of the conditions precedent set forth in Sections 2.3(a)(i) and 2.3(a)(ii) and Buyer will promptly notify Seller in writing upon the satisfaction of the condition precedent set forth in Section 2.3(a)(iii). If all of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 2.3(a) have not been satisfied (or waived by the Party on whose behalf the condition has been granted) on or before June 30, 2011, then either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the other Party, unless such Party's failure to perform its obligations under Section 2.3(b) shall be the reason that one or more of such conditions shall have not been satisfied. Termination of this Agreement pursuant to this Section 2.3(c) shall terminate all rights and obligations of the Parties under this Agreement, without any liability of one Party to the other Party except for any liabilities incurred prior to the effective date of termination and for prior breaches of this Agreement by a Party. RPSA. The Parties acknowledge and agree their respective obligations under this Agreement may be parallel to the obligations of the Parties under the RPSA. It is the intention of the Parties that for so long as this Agreement and the Boomerang Retail Contract are both in effect Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements shall not be satisfied with Energy or capacity deliveries under the RPSA. DELIVERY OF POWER Obligation to Sell and Purchase Power. Power. During each hour of the Delivery Period, Seller shall sell and deliver, or cause to be delivered, and Buyer shall purchase and receive, Power at the Delivery Points equal to Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements. Maximum Contract Capacity. On January 1 of each year during the Delivery Period, commencing with January 1, 2012, if (i) (A) the then-applicable Maximum Contract Capacity is greater than (B) the then-applicable Reduced Contract Capacity and (ii) Buyer fails to provide notice to Seller within ten (10) Business Days after January 1 of its election for the Maximum Contract Capacity to remain the then-applicable Maximum Contract Capacity, then the then-applicable Reduced Contract Capacity shall become the then-applicable Maximum Contract Capacity. If the Maximum Contract Capacity is reduced pursuant to this Section 3.1(b), the Maximum Contract Capacity shall not be increased in any subsequent year during the remainder of the Delivery Period without the consent of both Parties. Exclusivity. Buyer acknowledges and agrees that this Agreement constitutes an exclusive arrangement between Seller and Buyer with respect to Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements, and that Buyer shall not procure any Power or related services from any Person other than Seller in order to serve any portion of Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements; provided that, to the extent Seller fails to deliver Power it is required to deliver hereunder, Buyer may (in the ordinary course of business and to the extent the same does not constitute an effort to avoid the exclusive supply arrangement hereunder) purchase Power from a third party. Any failure by Buyer to comply with the foregoing exclusive supply arrangement shall constitute an Event of Default hereunder with respect to Buyer. Renewable Energy. At Buyer's request from time to time during the Delivery Period, Seller shall use commercially reasonable efforts to procure and deliver Energy hereunder which includes such percentage of energy generation from renewable energy resources as may be mandated by applicable laws ("Buyer's Renewable Energy"); provided that, such percentage does not exceed 10% of Buyer's Boomerang Power Requirements unless requested by Buyer and agreed to by Seller in its sole discretion; provided further that, Buyer shall have given Seller reasonable advance notice and opportunity to both procure the required Energy and have the Fixed Capacity Rate, Initial Fuel Rate, and the Cost Based Rates, as applicable, appropriately adjusted upwards to account for any increased cost associated with the required Energy. Source of Power Supply. Designated Resources. Subject to the other subsections of this Section 3.1(e), during the Delivery Period, Seller shall maintain arrangements in place to procure Power from one or more Designated Resources in order to meet all or part of its Power delivery obligations hereunder. Short-Term Replacement of Designated Resources. In the event any Designated Resource is unavailable, in whole or in part, for less than twelve (12) consecutive months for any reason (whether due to a Forced Outage, expiration of the contractual availability thereof, or otherwise), Seller shall enter into replacement power purchase arrangements to procure Energy, exclusive of capacity, necessary to meet its Energy delivery obligations under this Agreement (a "Short-Term Replacement Arrangement"). A Short-Term Replacement Arrangement shall not become a Designated Resource for purposes of this Agreement. Long-Term Replacement of Designated Resources. In the event any Designated Resource is or is expected to become unavailable, in whole or in part, for more than twelve (12) consecutive months for any reason (whether due to a Forced Outage, expiration of the contractual availability thereof, or otherwise), Seller shall have the right to designate one or more replacement resources or replacement power purchase arrangements as a Designated Resource, and upon such designation such replacement resource or replacement power purchase arrangement shall become a Designated Resource. Any such replacement resource or replacement power purchase arrangements need not be available for the remainder of the Delivery Period, provided that Seller shall designate another replacement resource or replacement power purchase arrangements as a Designated Resource prior to the scheduled unavailability or expiration thereof. From and after the Power Payment Flip Date, (A) Buyer shall be entitled to consult with Seller during the negotiation process as to the terms and structure for any such replacement power purchase arrangement, (B) Seller shall use commercially reasonable efforts to secure economic replacement resources, and (C) if the designation of any such replacement resource or replacement power purchase arrangements as a Designated Resource causes or is anticipated to cause the total amount charged to Buyer pursuant to the Cost Based Rates to increase by more than 10% (based on Buyer's usage during the twelve (12) month period immediately preceding the designation of such replacement resource or replacement power purchase arrangements as a Designated Resource), Buyer shall have the right, as its sole and exclusive remedy, to terminate this Agreement. Neither Party shall have any liability with respect to any such termination pursuant to the preceding sentence except that: (i) each Party shall remain liable for amounts accrued under this Agreement prior to such termination and (ii) Buyer shall reimburse Seller for costs reasonably incurred by Seller in unwinding any arrangement pursuant to which Seller has hedged its obligations under this Agreement, including any replacement power purchase arrangements. Supplemental Power Purchase Arrangements. Subject to clauses (ii) and (iii) of this Section 3.1(e), if at any time during the Delivery Term the Power available from the Designated Resources is not sufficient for Seller to meet its Power delivery obligations hereunder (including to meet any obligation to provide renewable energy), Seller shall enter into a supplemental power purchase arrangement to procure the Power necessary to meet its delivery obligations under this Agreement (a "Supplemental Supply Arrangement"). With respect to any Supplemental Supply Arrangement applicable to the period from and after the Power Payment Flip Date, Buyer shall be entitled to consult with Seller during the negotiation process as to the term and structure of such Supplemental Supply Arrangements and Seller shall use commercially reasonable efforts to secure economic Supplemental Supply Arrangements. A Supplemental Supply Arrangement shall not become a Designated Resource for purposes of this Agreement. Delivery Points. All deliveries and receipts of Power under this Agreement shall be made at the Delivery Points. Transmission. Subject to the provisions of the Entergy OATT, Buyer shall pay Seller for and Seller will act as Buyer's agent in obtaining and scheduling transmission service, including ancillary services (except for imbalance services which shall be provided as set forth in Section 3.4), for all Power purchased and received from Seller pursuant to this Agreement provided that such transmission is on the Entergy System. Scheduling; Delivery Imbalances. Seller shall arrange for delivery of Power to the Delivery Points and provide scheduling and related services with the Entergy Transmission Balancing Authority. The Parties agree to use commercially reasonable efforts to comply in all material respects with the operating protocols set forth in Exhibit C. Seller shall pay and shall have no right of reimbursement from Buyer for all Transmission Energy Imbalance Charges incurred in connection with all Power delivered pursuant to this Agreement. Seller shall be entitled to receive all Transmission Energy Imbalance Credits granted in connection with all Power delivered pursuant to this Agreement and Buyer shall pay to Seller any such amount received by or credited to Buyer. For each Month during the Delivery Period, (i) Seller shall calculate the Transmission Energy Imbalance Charges and Transmission Energy Imbalance Credits, (ii) Buyer shall be responsible for all transmission charges net of the Transmission Energy Imbalance Charges and the Transmission Energy Imbalance Credits, and (iii) Seller shall adjust the Invoice to the extent necessary to reflect the payment responsibilities of the Parties with respect to such charges and credits. Measurement. Measurement at the Boomerang Meter. All the Power delivered to the Delivery Points shall be measured at the Boomerang Meter and at the nominal voltage of 138,000 volts, unless otherwise mutually agreed upon by the Parties. Should Buyer request or the Entergy Balancing Authority require alternate or additional measurement points other than the Boomerang Meter, Seller will exercise due diligence to accommodate such request; provided that Buyer agrees to pay for any additional charges associated therewith. Buyer Metering Responsibilities. Buyer will own, operate, provide and maintain all necessary metering and telemetering equipment, assume full responsibility for, and will gather, through telemetry the level of Buyer's loads at the Boomerang Meter. All costs associated with the meter readings, translations, billing costs, and any applicable administrative and general expenses shall be borne by Buyer. Telemetered Signals. Buyer agrees to make available to Seller the telemetered signals reflecting the load measured at the Boomerang Meter. Such signals shall be (i) on a continuous basis; (ii) as a half-hourly digital MWh reading; and (iii) on an individual Boomerang Meter or combined basis as reasonably required by Seller in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices. Accuracy of Measuring Instruments. Either Party shall have the right at any time, and from time to time, upon giving forty-eight (48) hours notice to the other Party, to have the measuring instruments used to measure the Power delivered at Boomerang Meter tested, and if necessary, recalibrated, with the requesting Party represented at the test. The expense of any such test shall be borne by the Party requesting such test unless the measuring instruments are found to be in error in excess of plus or minus two percent (+ or – 2%); in which case, the cost of the test shall be paid by Buyer. The results of all such tests shall be provided to each Party. Inaccuracy Allowances. Any meter tested and found to be accurate within plus or minus two percent (+ or – 2%) shall be considered to be within the accepted range of accuracy. If, as a result of any test, any measuring instrument is found not to register within plus or minus two percent (+ or – 2%) accuracy, the readings of such measuring instrument previously taken shall be corrected according to the percentage of inaccuracy so found for the previous billing month; provided, however, if the date the measuring instrument inaccuracy began can be established, the correction shall apply retroactively to such date, but in no event shall the correction period apply beyond (i) the date that is ninety (90) days prior to the date on which the written request for a test was made or (ii) the date such measuring instrument was last tested, whichever is the shorter period. Seller shall bill or credit Buyer (as appropriate) for any billing adjustments for such inaccuracies. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, no correction for metering instrument inaccuracies will be made on any Invoice unless a Party shall request such correction in writing within ninety (90) days from the date of the Invoice. Estimate for Non-registry of Meter. If a meter fails to register at any time during any month, the Parties shall, as soon as practicable and on the basis of procedures to be mutually agreed by the Parties, estimate the Power delivered during such month on the basis of the best available data considering the actual Power delivered to the Boomerang Meter under substantially similar operating conditions when the metering devices were registering accurately. Condition of Equipment. The Parties agree not to injure or tamper with and to take all reasonable steps to prevent employees or other persons from injuring or tampering with the other Party's property, including but not limited to transformers, meters and other electrical equipment. The Parties agree to install and maintain in a thoroughly safe and efficient manner, and in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices and all applicable lawful regulations, their respective lines, wiring, apparatus, machinery, or appliances. If any lines, wiring, apparatus, machinery, or appliances are in a condition which interferes with a Party's proper service to another Party or to its customers, that Party shall have the right, in addition to any other right of discontinuance hereunder, to discontinue service until such interfering parts shall be put back in proper operating condition, or shall have been replaced or disconnected. Except in cases of emergency, a Party shall give the other Party reasonable written notice of its intention to discontinue service on account of any such claimed interference, and, when practical, suitable time for repair or the replacement of such interfering part. No Party assumes the duty of inspecting any other Party's lines, wiring, apparatus, machinery, or appliances, or any part thereof. Network Transmission Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event that any of the terms and provisions of the Network Transmission Agreement conflict with any terms and provisions of Section 3.5, the terms or provisions of the Network Transmission Agreement shall govern and control for all purposes. Title, Risk of Loss and Indemnity. As between the Parties, (a) prior to delivery to the Delivery Points, Seller shall be deemed to be in exclusive control (and responsible for any destruction of property or injury to persons caused thereby) of the Energy sold by Seller to Buyer hereunder and Buyer shall be deemed to be in exclusive control (and responsible for any destruction of property or injury to persons caused thereby) of all other Energy required to serve the Boomerang Load that is not sold by Seller to Buyer hereunder, and (b) from and after the Delivery Points, Buyer shall be deemed to be in exclusive control (and responsible for any destruction of property or injury to persons caused thereby) of the Energy sold by Seller to Buyer hereunder and all other Energy required to serve the Boomerang Load that is not sold by Seller to Buyer hereunder. Each Party shall save, defend and hold harmless (to the extent permitted by applicable law) the other Party from any Claims arising from any such destruction or injury for which such Party is responsible under the immediately preceding sentence. Seller warrants that the Energy delivered by Seller shall be free and clear of all liens, claims and encumbrances arising prior to the Delivery Points as the case may be. Title to and risk of loss related to the Energy shall transfer from Seller to Buyer upon delivery of the Energy at the Delivery Points, as the case may be. Prudent Utility Practice. Each of the Parties agrees that in the performance of this Agreement it will follow Prudent Utility Practice. PAYMENTS Energy and Capacity Payments Prior to Power Payment Flip Date. Each Month during the Delivery Period prior to the Power Payment Flip Date, all Power required to be delivered by Seller to Buyer hereunder shall be charged as set forth in this Section 4.1. Capacity. For each Month during the Delivery Period prior to the Power Payment Flip Date, Buyer shall pay to Seller the Initial Monthly Capacity Payment for such Month. Fuel. For each Month during the Delivery Period prior to the Power Payment Flip Date, Buyer shall pay to Seller the Initial Monthly Fuel Payment for such Month. Energy, Capacity and Fuel Payments After the Power Payment Flip Date. Each Month during the Delivery Period from and after the Power Payment Flip Date, all Power required to be delivered by Seller to Buyer hereunder shall be charged as set forth in this Section 4.2 based on such Power being sourced from a Designated Resource, a Short-Term Replacement Arrangement or a Supplemental Supply Arrangement, as applicable. Designated Resources and Short-Term Replacement Arrangements. For each Month during the Delivery Period from and after the Power Payment Flip Date, Buyer shall make the following payments to Seller for the Power delivered from Designated Resources or Short-Term Replacement Arrangements for such Month: Capacity. For each Month during the Delivery Period from and after the Power Payment Flip Date, Buyer shall pay to Seller the Cost Based Monthly Capacity Payment for such Month for Capacity delivered from Designated Resources during such Month. Energy. For each Month during the Delivery Period from and after the Power Payment Flip Date, Buyer shall pay to Seller the Cost Based Monthly Energy Payment for such Month for Energy delivered from Designated Resources during such Month. Fuel. For each Month during the Delivery Period from and after the Power Payment Flip Date, Buyer shall pay to Seller the Cost Based Monthly Fuel Payment for such Month. Adjustments to Cost Based Rates. The Parties acknowledge that the Reserve Capacity Rate, the Cost Based Contract Capacity Rate, the Cost Based Energy Rate, and the Cost Based Fuel Rate (collectively, the "Cost Based Rates") are based on Seller's costs associated with providing the Energy and associated Contract Capacity hereunder from the Designated Resources. Seller may adjust the Cost Based Rates (A) on an annual basis to reflect any changes to its costs or the Designated Resources and (B) at any other time, that Seller in its sole judgment, incurs increased costs, to the extent necessary to recover such increase in its costs. Seller shall obtain FERC approval or acceptance under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act prior to adjusting the rates set forth in Exhibit B under this Section 4.2(a)(iv). The standard of review for any Section 205 filing under this Section 4.2(a)(iv) shall be the "just and reasonable" standard of review. Cost of Energy Under Short-Term Replacement Arrangements. The Parties acknowledge that, from and after the Power Payment Flip Date, if during any Month the Energy delivered by Seller to Buyer hereunder was sourced, in whole or in part, from a Short-Term Replacement Arrangement, the cost of such Energy shall be included in the Cost Based Fuel Rate for such Month. Supplemental Supply Arrangement. From and after the Power Payment Flip Date, if during any Month any portion of the Power delivered by Seller to Buyer hereunder was sourced from a Supplemental Supply Arrangement, Buyer shall pay to Seller an amount equal to Seller's actual costs for such Power during such Month (the "Monthly Supplemental Supply Arrangement Payment"). CREDIT REQUIREMENTS. Credit Assurances. If either Party ("X") has reasonable grounds to believe that the other Party's ("Y") creditworthiness or performance under this Agreement has become unsatisfactory, X may demand Performance Assurance from Y in an amount determined by X in a commercially reasonable manner. Upon receipt of notice of such request Y shall have three (3) Business Days to remedy the situation by providing such Performance Assurance to X. "Performance Assurance" shall mean (i) a Letter of Credit, (ii) cash prepayment, or (iii) other security acceptable to X. Any Performance Assurance in the form of a Letter of Credit shall be subject to the following provisions: Each Letter of Credit shall be maintained for the benefit of X. Y shall cause the renewal of each outstanding Letter of Credit or issuance of a new Letter of Credit no later than 30 days prior to the expiry of each outstanding Letter of Credit or within one (1) Business Day of a Letter of Credit Default occurring. A "Letter of Credit Default" shall mean the occurrence of any of the following events (i) the issuer of such letter of credit shall fail to maintain a senior unsecured long term debt rating of a least "A-" by S&P or "A3" by Moody's, (ii) the issuer of such Letter of Credit shall fail to comply with or perform its obligations under such Letter of Credit if such failure shall be continuing after the lapse of any applicable grace period; (iii) the issuer of such Letter of Credit shall disaffirm, disclaim, repudiate or reject, in whole or in part, or challenge the validity of, such Letter of Credit; (iv) such Letter of Credit shall expire or terminate, or shall fail or cease to be in full force and effect at any time during the Term; (v) Y or the issuer of such Letter of Credit shall fail to cause the renewal or replacement Letter of Credit to X at least thirty (30) days prior to the expiration of such Letter of Credit; or (vi) any event analogous to an event specified in Section 8.1(d) of this Agreement shall occur with respect to the issuer of such Letter of Credit. A Letter of Credit shall provide that X may draw upon the Letter of Credit in an amount (up to the face amount for which the Letter of Credit has been issued) that is equal to all amounts that are due and owing from Y, but have not been paid to X within the time allowed for such payments under this Contract (including any related notice or grace period or both). Grant of Security Interest. To secure its obligations under this Agreement and to the extent either or both Parties deliver Performance Assurance hereunder, each Party (a "Pledgor") hereby grants to the other Party (the "Secured Party") a present and continuing security interest in, and lien on (and right of setoff against), and assignment of, all cash collateral and cash equivalent collateral and any and all proceeds resulting therefrom or the liquidation thereof, whether now or hereafter held by, on behalf of, or for the benefit of, such Secured Party, and each Party agrees to take such action as the other Party reasonably requires in order to perfect the Secured Party’s first-priority security interest in, and lien on (and right of setoff against), such collateral and any and all proceeds resulting therefrom or from the liquidation thereof. BILLING AND PAYMENT Monthly Invoices. Seller shall use reasonable efforts to render to Buyer on or before the fifteenth (15th) day of each Month during the Delivery Period an invoice for services provided hereunder during the previous Month (an "Invoice"); provided that, failure to provide an Invoice in a timely manner shall not affect Buyer's obligation to make a payment in accordance with Section 6.2 following receipt thereof. Such Invoice shall set forth the Monthly Capacity Payment, the Monthly Fuel Payment, the Cost Based Monthly Energy Payment, Monthly Supplemental Supply Arrangement Payment, any charges for transmission and distribution services, and any other payment obligations accrued by Buyer or Seller to the other during the applicable Month under this Agreement, which Seller shall net into a single amount owing from one Party to the other. Payment. Buyer shall make payment of the amount set forth on the Invoice on or before twenty (20) days after the date such Invoice is received. Buyer shall make payment in immediately available funds to the bank account designated in writing by Seller. Late Charges. Amounts due by either Party under this Agreement but not paid on or before the applicable due date thereof shall be payable with interest accrued at lesser of (a) the "Prime Rate" for domestic banks as published in The Wall Street Journal in the "Money Rates" section on the last Business Day of the Month in which service was required plus five hundred basis points and (b) the maximum rate permitted by applicable law. Such interest shall accrue daily from the due date until the date upon which payment is made. Billing Disputes. If Buyer, in good-faith, disputes the correctness of any Invoice, Buyer shall pay the undisputed amount and submit to Seller a detailed written explanation of the basis for the dispute. The Parties shall use their best efforts to attempt to resolve such disputes through negotiation on a timely basis. Upon determination of the correct Invoice amount, Buyer shall promptly pay the adjusted Invoice with the interest accrued in accordance with Section 6.3 and computed from the original due date to the date the adjustment is made. If Parties are unable to resolve the dispute through negotiation, the Parties shall follow the procedures set forth in Article 10. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES Representations and Warranties. As of the Execution Date, each Party with respect to itself, hereby represents and warrants to the other Party as follows: It is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction of its formation and is qualified to conduct its business in those jurisdictions necessary to perform this Agreement. It has the requisite organizational power and authority to execute, deliver and perform its obligations under this Agreement, and the execution and delivery of this Agreement and consummation of the transactions contemplated hereby have been duly and validly authorized and approved by all necessary action. This Agreement is duly and validly executed by such Party and this Agreement constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of such Party, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms, subject to bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization and other laws affecting creditor's rights generally, and the application of equitable principles regardless of whether enforcement is sought in a proceeding at law or in equity. No suit, claim, action, arbitration, or other legal, or administrative proceeding is pending or, to its knowledge, threatened against it or any of its Affiliates, which will adversely affect the validity or enforceability of this Agreement or its ability to fulfill its commitments hereunder in any material respect or that could result in any material adverse change in its business or financial condition. There are no bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, receivership or other similar proceedings pending or being contemplated by it or, to its knowledge, threatened against it. It has the power and authority to own and use its properties and to transact the business in which it is engaged and holds all franchises, material licenses and permits necessary and required therefor in each case as its business is currently transacted. Neither the execution and delivery of this Agreement nor the consummation of the transactions and performance of the terms and conditions contemplated hereby by it will (i) violate any material provision of any applicable law, (ii) conflict with or result in a violation of any provision of its articles of incorporation, by-laws, (iii) conflict in any material respect with any mortgage, indenture, contract, deed or other agreements or instrument to which it is a party or its assets are subject, or (iv) violate any judgment, award or decree binding on it or any of its properties. It has all Approvals necessary for it to legally perform its obligations under this Agreement, except as otherwise disclosed in Schedule 7.1(h). It has knowledge and experience in financial matters and the electric industry that enable it to evaluate the risks and merits of entering into this Agreement. It is acting for its own account, has made its own independent decision to enter into this Agreement and as to whether this Agreement is appropriate or proper for it based upon its own judgment, is not relying upon the advice or recommendations of the other Party in so doing, and is capable of assessing the merits of and understanding, and understands and accepts, the terms, conditions and risks of this Agreement. EVENTS OF DEFAULT AND REMEDIES Event of Default. With respect to a Party (the "Defaulting Party"), the occurrence of any of the following shall constitute an event of default under this Agreement (each, an "Event of Default"): the failure of the Defaulting Party to make, when due, any payment required under this Agreement if such failure is not remedied within five (5) Business Days after written notice of such failure is given to the Defaulting Party by the other Party; or any representation or warranty made by the Defaulting Party in this Agreement shall prove to have been false or misleading in any material respect when made or when deemed made or repeated; or the failure by the Defaulting Party to perform any material covenant or obligation set forth in this Agreement (except to the extent constituting a separate Event of Default), and such failure is not cured within thirty (30) days after written notice thereof to the Defaulting Party or if the failure is not of the type that can be reasonably cured within thirty (30) days, within a reasonable period so long as the Defaulting Party has commenced to cure the failure within such thirty (30) day period and thereafter diligently pursues such cure to completion within ninety (90) days; or the Defaulting Party shall: make an assignment or any general arrangement for the benefit of creditors; file a petition or otherwise commence, authorize or acquiesce in the commencement of a proceeding or cause of action under any bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, receivership or similar law for the protection of creditors, or have any such petition filed or commenced against it and such petition is not withdrawn or dismissed within sixty (60) days after such filing; otherwise become bankrupt or insolvent (however evidenced); or be generally unable to pay its debts as they fall due; or the Defaulting Party consolidates or amalgamates with, or merges with or into, or transfers all or substantially all of its assets to, another entity and, at the time of such consolidation, amalgamation, merger or transfer, the resulting, surviving or transferee entity fails to assume all the obligations of such Party under this Agreement to which it or its predecessor was a party by operation of law or pursuant to an agreement reasonably satisfactory to the other Parties; or the failure of the Defaulting Party to provide Performance Assurance when required under ARTICLE 5 or to otherwise comply with ARTICLE 5; or with respect to Buyer only, it fails to comply with Section 3.1(c) or there is otherwise a default with respect to Buyer under Section 3.1(c). Remedies Upon an Event of Default; Termination. If an Event of Default with respect to a Defaulting Party has occurred and is continuing, the other Party (the "Non-Defaulting Party") may, upon written notice to the Defaulting Party, do any one or more of the following: (i) designate a day, no earlier than the tenth day after such notice to the Defaulting Party is effective, on which this Agreement shall terminate ("Early Termination Date"), provided that such termination is subject to any applicable notice period to FERC as required by applicable law; (ii) accelerate all amounts owing between the Parties; (iii) withhold any payments due to the Defaulting Party under this Agreement or, if an Event of Default with respect to Buyer has occurred, suspend deliveries of Energy under this Agreement; (iv) take any of the following actions: (A) exercise any of the rights and remedies of a Secured Party with respect to all Performance Assurance, including any such rights and remedies under applicable law then in effect; (B) exercise its rights of setoff against any and all property of the Defaulting Party in the possession of the Non-Defaulting Party or its agent; (C) draw on any outstanding Letter of Credit issued for its benefit; or (D) liquidate all Performance Assurance then held by or for the benefit of the Non-Defaulting Party free from any claim or right of any nature whatsoever of the Defaulting Party, including any equity or right of purchase or redemption by the Defaulting Party; or (iv) exercise such other remedies may be available at law or in equity, subject however to the limitations on remedies and damages described in this Agreement and to the dispute resolution provisions of ARTICLE 10. The proceeds of the collateral realized upon the exercise of the rights and remedies described in subsections (iv) above shall be used to reduce the Defaulting Party’s obligations under this Agreement (the Defaulting Party remaining liable for any amounts owing to the Non-Defaulting Party after such application), subject to the Non-Defaulting Party’s obligation to return any surplus proceeds remaining after such obligations are satisfied in full. In the event that an Early Termination Date is designated, the Parties shall continue to invoice, credit, and pay for Energy previously delivered and neither Party shall be relieved by such termination of any obligation incurred or arising prior to the Early Termination Date. If this Agreement is terminated pursuant to this Section 8.2, Seller is entitled to recovery of costs reasonably incurred by Seller in unwinding any arrangement pursuant to which it has hedged its obligations under this Agreement, including any replacement power purchase arrangements. Set-Off. If an Event of Default occurs, the Non-Defaulting Party may at its election set off any or all amounts which the Defaulting Party owes it, whether under this Agreement or otherwise and whether or not then due, against any and all amounts which it owes to the Defaulting Party, whether under this Agreement or otherwise and whether or not then due, provided that any amount not then due which is included in such set off shall be discounted to present value in a commercially reasonable manner. The remedy provided for in this Section 8.3 shall be without prejudice and in addition to any right of setoff, combination of accounts, lien or other right to which any Party is at any time otherwise entitled (whether by operation of law, contract or otherwise). Limitation of Remedies, Liability and Damages. THE PARTIES CONFIRM THAT THE EXPRESS REMEDIES AND MEASURES OF DAMAGES PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT SATISFY THE ESSENTIAL PURPOSES HEREOF. FOR BREACH OF ANY PROVISION FOR WHICH AN EXPRESS REMEDY OR MEASURE OF DAMAGES IS HEREIN PROVIDED, SUCH EXPRESS REMEDY OR MEASURE OF DAMAGES SHALL BE THE SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY, THE OBLIGOR'S LIABILITY SHALL BE LIMITED AS SET FORTH IN SUCH PROVISION AND ALL OTHER REMEDIES OR DAMAGES AT LAW OR IN EQUITY ARE WAIVED. IF NO REMEDY OR MEASURE OF DAMAGES IS EXPRESSLY HEREIN PROVIDED, THE OBLIGOR'S LIABILITY SHALL BE LIMITED TO DIRECT ACTUAL DAMAGES ONLY, SUCH DIRECT ACTUAL DAMAGES SHALL BE THE SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY AND ALL OTHER REMEDIES OR DAMAGES AT LAW OR IN EQUITY ARE WAIVED. UNLESS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT, NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE FOR CONSEQUENTIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, EXEMPLARY OR INDIRECT DAMAGES, LOST PROFITS OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION DAMAGES, BY STATUTE, IN TORT OR CONTRACT, UNDER INDEMNITY PROVISION OR OTHERWISE. IT IS THE INTENT OF THE PARTIES THAT THE LIMITATIONS HEREIN IMPOSED ON REMEDIES AND THE MEASURE OF DAMAGES BE WITHOUT REGARD TO THE CAUSE OR CAUSES RELATED THERETO, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, THE NEGLIGENCE OF ANY PARTY, WHETHER SUCH NEGLIGENCE BE SOLE, JOINT OR CONCURRENT, OR ACTIVE OR PASSIVE. TO THE EXTENT ANY DAMAGES REQUIRED TO BE PAID HEREUNDER ARE LIQUIDATED, THE PARTIES ACKNOWLEDGE THAT THE DAMAGES ARE DIFFICULT OR IMPOSSIBLE TO DETERMINE, OTHERWISE OBTAINING AN ADEQUATE REMEDY IS INCONVENIENT AND THE LIQUIDATED DAMAGES CONSTITUTE A REASONABLE APPROXIMATION OF THE HARM OR LOSS. FORCE MAJEURE Neither Party shall be considered to be in default in the performance of any obligations (other than the obligation to make payments due under this Agreement) under this Agreement when a failure of performance is due to an uncontrollable force designated herein as an event of "Force Majeure." The term "Force Majeure" means any cause beyond the control of the Party affected, including but not restricted to: (i) acts of God, (ii) acts of the public enemy or terrorists, (iii) failure or threat of failure of generating and/or transmission facilities arising from or related to an event of Force Majeure, (iv) sudden actions of the elements such as lightning, flood, earthquake, tornado, storm, fire, (v) strike, labor dispute, labor or material shortage, (vi) sabotage, (vii) actions or inactions by any Governmental Authority taken after the date hereof (including the adoption or change in any rule or regulation or environmental constraints lawfully imposed by such Governmental Authority), but only if such requirements, actions, or failures to act prevent or delay performance, and (viii) any delay, interruption, or curtailment in transmission service, or loss of transmission facilities. Force Majeure shall also mean restraints on performance imposed by court order or public authority, and actions or non-actions by, or the inability to obtain or maintain in effect the necessary authorizations from any governmental agency or authority, which by exercise of due diligence such Party could not reasonably have been expected to avoid and which by exercise of due diligence it has been unable to overcome. No Party shall, however, be relieved of liability for failure of performance if such failure is due to causes arising out of its own negligence and/or circumstances which can be removed or remedied and which it fails to remove or remedy within a reasonable time period. Nothing in this ARTICLE 9 shall be construed so as to require Seller to deliver, or Buyer to receive, Energy at points other than the Delivery Point. Nothing in this ARTICLE 9 shall be construed so as to require a Party to settle any strike or labor dispute in which it may be involved. It is understood and agreed that the settlement of strikes, walkouts, lockouts or other labor disputes shall be entirely within the discretion of the Party having the difficulty. Either Party rendered unable to fulfill any of its obligations under this Agreement by reason of Force Majeure shall give prompt written notice of such inability to perform to the other Party and shall exercise due diligence to remove such inability with all reasonable dispatch. DISPUTE RESOLUTION Informal Negotiation. The Parties shall attempt in good faith to resolve any dispute, claim or controversy arising out of or relating to this Agreement (a "Dispute") through informal negotiation. Either Party may initiate informal negotiation by sending a notice (the "Dispute Notice") to the other Party setting forth the particulars of the Dispute and the relief requested. The recipient of such notice shall respond in writing within five (5) Business Days with a statement of its position on, and recommended solution to, the Dispute. If the Dispute is not resolved by this exchange of correspondence, then representatives of each Party with authority to settle the Dispute shall meet at a mutually agreeable time and place within ten (10) Business Days of the date of the initial notice in order to attempt in good faith to resolve the Dispute. Legal Rights and Remedies. If any Dispute has not been resolved by negotiation as provided in Section 10.1 within ninety (90) days after delivery of the Dispute Notice, then, subject to any limitations on damages or remedies contained in this Agreement, the Parties shall be free to exercise any and all remedies available at law or in equity; provided, however, a Party may at any time file a complaint in a court having jurisdiction to seek a temporary restraining order, preliminary injunction and/or other provisional judicial relief. Despite such action for provisional remedies, the Parties shall continue to participate in good faith in the procedures specified in Section 10.1. All applicable statutes of limitation and defenses based on the passage of time shall be tolled while the procedures called for in Section 10.1 are pending. In the event of any court proceedings, the Parties agree to undertake whatever steps are necessary to maintain the confidentiality of this Agreement. MISCELLANEOUS Entirety of Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the entire Agreement between the Parties with reference to the subject matter hereof and specifically supersede all previous understandings and agreements, whether written or oral between the Parties). Binding Effect. This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be binding upon the Parties and their respective successors and permitted assigns. No assignment or transfer permitted hereunder shall relieve Seller or Buyer of any of their respective obligations under this Agreement. Assignment. Neither Party shall assign this Agreement or any of its rights or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may, without the need for consent from the other Party (and without relieving itself of its obligations hereunder) transfer or assign this Agreement to an Affiliate of such Party, so long as, in the reasonable determination of the other Party, such Affiliate's creditworthiness is equal to or higher than that of such Party; provided, however, that (x) the assignee shall make representations to the other Party identical to those under Section 7.1, and (y) the assignee shall agree in writing to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement. Confidentiality. Neither Party shall voluntarily disclose the terms or conditions of this Agreement or the information or data provided by either Party to the other Party in connection with the performance or administration of this Agreement to a third party (other than the Party's Affiliates, employees, lenders, counsel, accountants or advisors who have a need to know such information and have agreed to keep such terms confidential) except in connection with Seller’s negotiation of any replacement power purchase arrangement or in order to comply with any applicable law, regulation, or any exchange, control area or independent system operator rule or in connection with any court or regulatory proceeding; provided, however, each Party shall, to the extent practicable, use reasonable efforts to prevent or limit the disclosure. The Parties shall be entitled to all remedies available at law or in equity to enforce, or seek relief in connection with, this confidentiality obligation. Taxes. The Parties agree and intend that the Energy sold by Seller to Buyer under this Agreement will be resold by Buyer, and that accordingly applicable taxes will not be due on these transactions. Either Party, upon written request of the other, shall provide a certificate of exemption or other reasonably satisfactory evidence of exemption if either is exempt from taxes and shall use reasonable efforts to administer this Agreement in accordance with the intent to minimize taxes and other governmental charges. Notices. All notices, requests, statements or demands shall, unless otherwise specified herein, be in writing and may be delivered by hand delivery, registered or certified United States mail (postage prepaid), overnight courier service or facsimile, and if given to Seller is addressed to: If to Buyer: Sam Rayburn Municipal Power Agency 310 Main Street Jasper, Texas 77575 Attention: President Fax: (409) 327-7045 Tel: (409) 327-5303
If to Seller:
EWO Marketing, Inc. 2001 Timberloch Place 1st Floor – South The Woodlands, Texas 77380 Attention: President Fax: 281-297-5458 Tel: (281) 297-5550
Notice by facsimile or hand delivery shall be effective on the day actually received, if received during business hours on a Business Day, and otherwise shall be effective on the next Business Day. Notice by overnight courier or registered or certified United States mail shall be effective on the next Business Day after it was sent. A Party may change its address by providing notice of same in accordance herewith. Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in several counterparts, each of which is an original and all of which constitute one and the same instrument. Amendment or Modification. This Agreement may not be modified or amended except by an instrument or instruments in writing signed by both Parties. No Waiver. Any waiver by any Party of its rights with respect to any provision in this Agreement, or with respect to any other matter arising in connection with this Agreement, shall not be deemed a waiver with respect to any other matter arising in connection with this Agreement and shall not be deemed a waiver with respect to any subsequent matter. Severability. Except as otherwise stated herein, any provision or article declared or rendered unlawful by a court of law or regulatory agency or jurisdiction over the Parties, or deemed unlawful because of a statutory change, will not otherwise affect the lawful obligations that arise under this Agreement. In such circumstances, the Parties agree to negotiate in good faith to restore the agreement as near as possible to the original intent and effect. No Third Party Beneficiaries. Nothing in this Agreement shall provide any benefit to any third party or entitle any third party to any claim, cause of action, remedy or right of any kind, it being the intent of the Parties that this Agreement shall not be construed as a third party beneficiary contract. Governing Law. THIS AGREEMENT AND THE RIGHTS AND DUTIES OF THE PARTIES HEREUNDER SHALL BE GOVERNED BY AND CONSTRUED, ENFORCED AND PERFORMED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LAWS OF THE STATE OF TEXAS, WITHOUT GIVING EFFECT TO PRINCIPLES OF CONFLICTS OF LAWS. Venue and Jurisdiction. For the purposes of initiating any legal action or proceeding arising under or relating to this Agreement or for recognition or enforcement of any judgment therefrom each Party expressly agrees to file its complaint exclusively in the State or Federal Courts located in Harris County, Texas. Each Party consents to exclusive jurisdiction and venue in Harris County, Texas and agrees to waive any objection to these forums (including, but not limited to, any venue or forum non conveniens grounds) and each Party waives the right to transfer venue from the State or Federal Courts located in Harris County. Each of the Parties agree that a final judgment in any such action or proceeding may be enforced in other jurisdictions by suit on the judgment or in any other manner provided by applicable law. Further Assurances. The Parties shall execute such additional documents, and shall cause such additional action to be taken as may be required or, in the reasonable judgment of any Party, may be necessary or desirable, to effect or evidence the provisions of this Agreement and the transactions contemplated hereby. Relationship of the Parties. The relationship of the Parties is that of independent contractors. The Parties are not, by virtue of this Agreement or otherwise, in an employer-employee, principal-agent, joint venture, or partnership relationship with each other. Forward Contract. The Parties acknowledge and agree that this Agreement and all transactions contemplated hereby constitute "forward contracts" within the meaning of the United States Bankruptcy Code. Standard of Review and Waivers. Nothing contained in this Agreement shall limit in any way the ability of Seller to exercise its rights under the Federal Power Act Section 205 or the ability of Buyer to exercise its rights under the Federal Power Act Section 206 to propose changes to the Agreement, including, but not limited to, changes to the rates set forth herein. Absent the agreement of all Parties to the proposed change, the standard of review for changes to this Agreement proposed by Seller or Buyer shall be the "just and reasonable" standard of review. Changes to this Agreement proposed by non-contracting parties shall be subject to the most stringent standard of review permissible under applicable law. Imaged Agreement. Any original executed Agreement or other related document may be photocopied and/or stored on computer tapes and disks (the "Imaged Agreement"). The Imaged Agreement, if introduced as evidence in automated facsimile form, and all computer records of the foregoing, if introduced as evidence in printed format, in any judicial, arbitration, mediation or administrative proceedings, will be admissible as between the Parties to the same extent and under the same conditions as other business records originated and maintained in documentary form. Neither Party shall object to the admissibility of the Imaged Agreement (or photocopies of the Imaged Agreement) on the basis that such were not originated or maintained in documentary form under either the hearsay rule, the best evidence rule or other rule of evidence. [Remainder of Page Intentionally Left Blank; Signature page follows.]
